name: Account Executive_30377
description:
About us:

Our motivation to create Fleetsmith stemmed from our deep frustration with existing computer management solutions. We knew we could do a lot better. Our product is powerful, yet incredibly easy-to-use. We bring the product and design focus traditionally only associated with consumer companies to the “enterprise software” space. We’re a company where product comes first, where brand and product are intertwined, and where design is not an afterthought, but is fundamental to the process of building a product our customers love.

 

Fleetsmith solves the computer management problem for IT and Security teams: simple and secure provisioning, configuration enforcement, and inventory of devices.

The role:

We’re hiring an Account Executive who is creative and determined to find solutions, no matter the challenge. As an early sales hire, you’ll help build our sales infrastructure and culture from the ground up. You’ll grow professionally across several dimensions, including the ability to step up and help lead if you prove you’re ready

 

Our Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 2-6 years of professional experience. At least 2 years of highly successful B2B sales experience. This is a key individual contributor role
  • Entrepreneurial-mind with a strong drive and desire to be part of a rapidly growing business.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment with shifting priorities.
  • Excellent written and oral communication, including slide presentations skills

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prospecting & Lead Generation: Prospect within the highly qualified free user base and upgrade users as appropriate. Partner with Marketing to generate new leads through referrals, networking, cold calls/emails, and more.
  • Sales: Be responsible for building your own pipeline. Sell by video conference/phone/email, conduct demos and trials with prospects, then turn them into happy customers.
  • Customer Success: partner with customer service to ensure key customers have a successful onboarding experience. Remain closely involved not only as the customer first tries Fleetsmith but also during their first year using Fleetsmith.
  • Voice of the Customer: Be an advocate for premium users of Fleetsmith. Partner with Product and Marketing teams to iterate on messaging, positioning, pricing, and packaging to identify the best fit for customer needs

 

What we can offer - Benefits & Perks:

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Dog friendly office
  • Park right outside
  • Full stocked kitchen
  • Deck out back
  • Top tier PPO - + 90% covered for dependants.
  • 401K
  • Amazing friendly culture

 

FleetSmith is an equal opportunity employer and actively seeks diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
subjects: Network & Security, Management, Motivation, Religion & Spirituality, Sales, Video & Mobile Marketing

name: Android Developer_30370
description:
eTecc / Interactive is a nimble design and development studio headquartered in Naperville IL with a satellite office in Chicago's West Loop. We specialize in creating web and mobile applications, constantly push the limits of our abilities - and we work on awesome stuff. Our team works with companies at every stage of development, from funded startups who are creating new products, to established organizations who need to cultivate new technologies or digital solutions. We apply our mantra of define, explore, design and execute when creating exceptional experiences for our clients.

Opportunity

We want to hire someone like us. We are looking for a person who is excited to work alongside a growing design and development team to build awesome Android apps. 

Description

The Android Developer position will be responsible for architecting, writing, and managing web site applications for eTecc's portfolio of clients. This position will collaborate with other developers & designers and take an active role in the scope and definition of project requirements. The candidate will also recommend the appropriate architecture and timeline estimates.

  • You will participate in discovery meetings and help craft solutions to meet client deliverables.

Principal Hiring Points

  • Experience in building Android apps in native and non-native environments

Requirements

  • Demonstrates both strong teamworking abilities & the ability to work independently as necessary
  • Demonstrate professional demeanor and customer-focused orientation
  • Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Strong proficiency in the English language (written and verbal)

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Health insurance coverage
  • Paid vacation time, sick days, and personal days
  • Casual Work Environment
  • Free snacks & coffee

name: Associate Director of User Experience_30396
description:
Manifest’s Experience Design team is on the hunt for an Associate Director in Chicago. In this leadership role, you’ll work with cross-functional teams to craft large-scale digital experiences, and lead efforts to continually evolve the experience design practice.

Responsibilities:

•       Inspired leadership that involves organizing and leading design and research efforts to create useful, usable, and compelling cross-channel experiences

•       Infusing user-centered design, design thinking, design strategy, and data-influenced design into projects and the organization

•       Enabling collaboration with XD team members, cross-functional teams, and clients – ensuring the best ideas are surfaced, embraced, and brought to life

•       Proactively making the team better by mentoring, optimizing process, introducing design trends, supporting continuous learning, and modeling respectful and supportive behaviors

•       Thinking big, pursuing innovation, continually raising the bar, willing to go the extra mile, and driving to deliver high-quality experiences for clients and customers

•       Juggling multiple projects, and moving in and out of leadership and individual contributor roles.

•       Obsessed with making everything around you better

Requirements:

•       At least 9 years of UX design and research experience

•       Bachelor’s Degree in Human Computer Interaction or equivalent field

•       Digital agency experience

•       A portfolio showcasing your ability to apply user-centered design to a variety of challenges

•       Strong communication skills, including writing and presenting

•       Deep familiarity with all facets of user-centered design

•       Proven experience with large-scale responsive websites and mobile apps

•       Experience with creating design systems a plus

•       Some travel to out-of-state clients

Manifest is an equal opportunity employer. Manifest does not sponsor employment visas.

name: Backend Developer_30416
description:
Cornershop Creative (https://cornershopcreative.com) is seeking an awesome, U.S.-based backend developer to join our distributed team. This will be a short-term, full-time 4-6 month engagement to help with specific projects. (We hope this will turn into a permanent full-time position, but we can’t guarantee that at the moment.)

 

The core responsibility for this position will be building custom API integrations and scripting data migrations for WordPress-based websites and applications for our non-profit and small business clients. Tasks may include setting up WordPress custom post types, fields and taxonomies; troubleshooting server errors and migrating sites to different hosts; integrating WordPress data with third-party tools like SalesForce and Blackbaud products; and creating scripts to migrate data from other CMSes and data structures to WordPress. Additionally, this position may be responsible for developing and maintaining custom WordPress plugins.

 

While our primary need is strong PHP skills with solid experience building sites and applications in WordPress, our ideal candidate will have familiarity and eagerness to learn to code in other languages and on other frameworks (e.g. javascript, mobile app development, Laravel).

 

Our ideal candidate is a hard-working, curious troubleshooter comfortable working independently with little supervision who also enjoys working as part of a team that includes developers and non-developers. Since we're a distributed shop, you’ll get to work from home! Cool, right?

 

Some Things You’ll Need to be Comfortable With:

  • Making WordPress sync data with common (and not so common) third-party REST & SOAP APIs

  • Crafting ingenious scripts to migrate datasets from outside systems, such as other CMSes, into WordPress, even when their character encoding isn’t what you want it to be

  • WordPress theming, including the template hierarchy, hooks, WP_Query, etc.

  • Finding existing libraries, plugins or other internal/external solutions to solve programming challenges, rather than reinventing the wheel

  • Deploying websites onto production hosts via git, rsync (and maybe sometimes sFTP), configuring caching, updating DNS records, and associated launch tasks

  • Quickly and effectively maintaining/troubleshooting/supporting code written by other developers

  • Command line tools like git, gulp, and wp-cli

  • JavaScript (particularly in jQuery)

  • Laughing at our stupid jokes (and the occasional good one)

  • Performing basic devops/Linux sysadmin tasks like writing bash scripts, configuring web or database servers, and figuring out why the “uploads don’t work!”

  • Troubleshooting MySQL performance issues (and writing performant queries)

  • Working in a fast-paced environment (we keep pretty busy!) and managing a workload of several projects at a time

  • Utilizing superb written and oral communication skills

 

Other stuff we’d love it if you’re good at, but aren’t requirements:

  • Working with and customizing Buddy/bbPress and WooCommerce

  • Drafting functional requirements that specify the appropriate technologies, techniques and architectures necessary to bring needed features to life

  • Working with other developers to implement the aforementioned plans

  • Not losing your s#!% when you occasionally get feedback like “Nevermind. We actually need that field that we told you not to migrate” (and then getting asked to change it back), which may happen despite our best efforts

  • Working with nonprofit CRM tools such as Salsa, Luminate Online, Engaging Networks, and Salesforce

  • Remembering to un-mute yourself before talking on conference calls

  • Being passionate about progressive causes

  • Writing custom CSS/SASS for cross-browser, responsive design (not just by using Bootstrap)

  • Configuring and/or maintaining AWS environments for hosting PHP-based websites and applications

  • Mucking around with Laravel

 

Cornershop Creative is an award-winning online services agency committed to listening carefully to our non-profit and small business clients and helping them achieve their goals. Our designs are beautiful, and our websites are creative and innovative. Learn more about us at https://cornershopcreative.com/.

 

To apply, send an email to jobs@cornershopcreative.com with the following:

  • Your résumé, which should include an indication of which American state you live and work in

  • A brief cover letter, explaining why you’re excited about this opportunity

  • Links to work you’ve done that we should see, such as recent websites, git repos, or contributed plugins/modules/themes

  • Ideal hourly rate

 

U.S. Applicants only!

 

Please be sure to include all of these items — to save everyone valuable time we’ll throw out incomplete applications. Thanks for understanding.

 

 

Cornershop is an equal opportunity employer.
subjects: Other, Data & Analytics, Network & Security, Production, Sales, Black & White, Salesforce

name: Backend Web Developer (Laravel)_30381
description:
Who We Are

ScaleLab is a leading digital talent network on a mission to help online influencers expand their audience and overall career through technology and top-level agency services. We represent thousands of established social media stars and pride ourselves on providing each of them with the tools, support, community and resources they need to grow on and beyond the digital platforms they’ve mastered. Developing cutting-edge technology that utilizes years of industry experience combined with the enormous amounts of data provided by our large client-base is the core of the future of our company. This is where you come in!


Who are we looking for

Are you a type of person who loves to dive into a new technology stack? Are you self-motivated to explore and embrace new trends, routines, and technology? Do you love to work in a small and productive team?

We are looking for an experienced, LA-based Backend Engineer who will play a key role in ScaleLab’s vision for an integrated experience for brands and influencers. You will be a part of a small engineering team improving on our current suite of products, as well as building a brand new product that’s meant to revolutionize the influencer marketing industry.  


Requirements

- 5+ years of back end development (PHP)

- Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills, motivation, and passion

- Expert level PHP with Laravel 5 framework

- Practical experience building and consuming RESTful APIs

- Strong knowledge of PHP 7, SOLID (object-oriented design), Object-relational mapping and LEMP stacks

- Experience in OOP (object oriented programming) & SOA (Service-oriented architecture)

- Strong MySQL knowledge (table design, complex query creation, best practices)

- Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, asset loading, caching, REST)

- Experience writing unit and integration tests

- Experience using CI/CD tools and systems such as Jenkins, Hudson, GitLab, GitHub, etc.

- Experience with Symfony is a plus

- Experience with Docker is a plus

- Experience with Websockets is a plus


Responsibilities

- Design, develop, and maintain various backend APIs using Laravel and PHP7

- Write and maintain clean, well-written, test-driven PHP code and documentation conforming to standards

- Troubleshoot, identify and resolve API performance problems

- Optimize database schema, queries, and caching

- Collaborate with peers on best practices and promote knowledge sharing

- Release early, release often
subjects: Data & Analytics, Network & Security, Influence, Motivation, Media, Industry

name: Blockchain company looking for Front-end Web UI/UX Developer who wants to change the world_30346
description:
Blockchain company looking for Front-end Web UI/UX Developer who wants to change the world

 

About You

  • You live in San Diego, CA and do not need to be convinced that working in a fast-paced blockchain company out of our Hacker HQ in downtown San Diego is a badass opportunity.
  • You are an awesome Frontend Web UI/UX Developer
  • A master of JS, HTML, CSS, SASS, etc.
  • Comfortable with photoshop gulp, react, and brownie points for node.js
  • You make stunning subtle animations to sites possible
  • You are fine with fast-paced, startup environments (we are not necessarily a startup; we are a multimillion dollar blockchain and location technology company founded in 2012, but have the feel of a startup out of the show Silicon Valley)
  • The idea of building the "Aviato" of the blockchain world excites you.
  • You actually get that reference.
  • You're able to work fulltime
  • You are fine working in-person 
  • You have significant experience developing front-end websites and apps
  • Brownie points if you are comfortable wearing the DevOps hat if needed to make sure AWS is set up to scale and run smoothly
  • You have experience with Bootstrap UI Framework and can also make badass JS/CSS animations (beautiful subtle stuff like: https://iota.org/)
  • You're familiar with Github best practices/workflow 
  • You have experience with Amazon Web Services: EC2, S3 and CloudFront

About XYO

Visit https://www.xyo.network to have your mind blown.

The XYO Network is the world's first Proof of Location blockchain project with over 1 million Bluetooth and GPS devices in the world. Please visit https://www.xyo.network to learn more. 

The company behind XYO Network is XY Findables, which was started in 2012 and has produced over 1 million devices in the Bluetooth & GPS findables businesses (competing and becoming the premiere product even while competing against large-funded brands like Tile). Here is the corporate website of XY Findables (https://www.xyfindables.com/).

We are looking for a Senior Front-end Web Developer who can both manage our front-facing web properties and take them to the next level (sites like https://www.xyo.network) as well as someone who will then transition into developing our suite of web apps and tools. 

Next steps

If the above looks good to you, please apply and include answers to these:

  1. Do you live near San Diego, and are you able to work in-person in our office in downtown San Diego?
  2. When can you start?
  3. Your work samples showcasing your work in creating beautiful sites with subtle animation (like: https://iota.org/); and anything else.
  4. Resume
  5. Do you consider yourself more of a front-end UI/UX developer or backend node.js type of programmer? (Please describe your experience and skill-level in web apps as well as web site UI/UX development.)
  6. Your personal website, portfolio and/or Github profile
  7. How comfortable are you with slicing photoshop files and converting to web?

name: Client Care Specialist_30374
description:
Do you have the ability to read into a question and really understand what someone is asking? Does ‘making someone's day' get you out of bed in the morning? Do you want to work with a company that really makes a difference in the lives of others?

We are looking for a rockstar Client Care Specialist to join our team and provide superior customer service that exceeds our client's expectations.

What You'll be Doing

You get to work from home with an amazing team of Client Care Specialists that care deeply about building and strengthening our client relationships. You will educate clients on our products and respond to tough (and not-so-tough) inquiries through email using Desk.com and on live chat using Intercom.io. You will also make the occasional phone call. Yep, you'll be responding to LOTS of people and putting smiles on their faces all day. That takes a certain kind of person. If that's you...read on.

Our Ideal Candidate

Knows their stuff. This can't be your first rodeo. You have at least 2 years of experience in a web-based, service oriented company providing customer support where email and live chat were your primary responsibilities.

Can read between the lines. Sometimes a client's question isn't always obvious, and I'm sure you know, a lot can get lost in 'email' translation. A client may be asking for one thing, and really need something else. You have an uncanny ability to read into what they are looking for, ask the right questions, and exceed their expectations by responding to their real question.

Has great sleuthing skills. You are able to do your own detective work and find clues with the tools you have access to. You never pass on a case without first trying to piece the puzzle together.

Is an exceptional communicator. You know how to get your message across clearly and concisely to different audiences, through the written word. You are a skilled writer and have outstanding proofreading skills. Yup, you're a natural here.

Embraces sales. You understand that part of your role is to be a frontline salesperson and you see this as an important part of how you approach your work.

Cares. You are an empathetic advocate for our clients. You recognize that through email, you are building relationships, making our customers feel cared for, and quickly solving problems if an experience doesn't go 100% as planned. You care about our clients having accurate information and are getting their issues resolved.

Is thorough and obsessed with the details. You are careful, cautious, and incredibly meticulous; some may even call you nitpicky - in an endearing way, of course! And, you dream about dotting the i's and crossing the t's. Nothing slips by the net when you're goalie.

Is comfortable with frequent pivots. You have the ability to prioritize and re-prioritize your work in a fast-changing environment - you understand that things change as new information is made available. You don't mind shifting gears and are skilled at having a few balls up in the air at one time.

Is committed to their craft. You were meant to be in Client Care. It is your unique ability. It's not a stepping stone to join PN or to gain some experience to launch another career. You care about people and want to be sure they have everything they need to make the right decision for themselves and get their questions answered.

Has the ability to work independently and can ramp up quickly, for more intense periods of work. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don't need a lot of direction. That said, you are not on an island. You'll get plenty of help and support from the team when you need it and when it gets busy during launch periods and the team needs you - you'll jump right in.

Leaves their ego at the door. You have integrity, talent, are outgoing, have a palpable excitement about the future, and don't show it off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, and excessive 'constructive criticism' are out.

Wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization. PN is a pretty incredible place and is committed to allowing you to do the work you love and love the work you do.

Life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching. That's our mission at Precision Nutrition.

As an organization, we:

  • Seek and support diversity.
  • Offer 4 weeks paid time-off, benefits, and the ability to work remotely.
  • Set you up with whatever fancy gear you need to perform at your best.
  • Give you the flexibility to make your own schedule.

Not only that, but if you join us you can:

  • Work in the fitness and nutrition industry. We love exercise, we love nutrition, and we love sport. That's why we started this company. If you do too, you'll appreciate how rare it is to find a career you really love. For active, fit people, Precision Nutrition is that opportunity.
  • Work with fun, bright, and talented people. We're a small company, and we're picky about who we work with, because to us, this isn't just a job; it's our life.

If you or someone you know is interested in the position we welcome you to apply below. Please only apply if you are committed to the Client Care field. Only serious applicants will be considered and not those looking for an opportunity to get into PN.
subjects: Other, Sales, Nutrition, Fitness, Industry

name: Content Strategist_30408
description:
Think Company has been named one of the Best Places to Work by the Philadelphia Business Journal and one of the Top Workplaces by Philly.com!

Think Company is looking for a Content Strategist to join our Team! Think Company is a team of business-minded designers, developers, and thinkers who help our clients envision, design, and create great experiences for their customers and employees. We assist our clients in creating, designing and developing their ideas, executing on those ideas, and making them a reality.

The Content Strategist’s primary responsibilities consist of overseeing the planning, management, and development of content for interactive projects, including optimization of content across multiple delivery channels. The Content Strategist works closely with the Product Owners and UX Designers throughout all stages of the project to ensure content is presented in a manner consistent with brand guidelines, achieving the goals of the business, and meeting the needs of the user.   

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Understand client brand & business objectives and apply these goals to the planning, creation, and maintenance of content
  • Independently create both long-form and short-form branding, marketing, editorial, and instructional content
  • Leverage existing copy decks and content to create additional content
  • Conduct site content audits or content inventories to assess the value, organization, and consistency of existing content
  • Actively participate in brainstorming sessions
  • Adapt language and style to reflect client-specific voice and tone
  • Collaborate with Design Lead and other designers to ensure that design and copy compliment one another
  • Clearly, present concepts and effectively communicate the rationale for design and content decisions
  • Actively participate in meetings and conversations, listening attentively for content and context of a message from both colleagues and clients
  • Reviewing software development documentation for standards such as metadata, labels, and site taxonomies

Qualifications

  • Proven work experience as a Content Strategist, Content Manager, or similar role
  • 2–5 years developing consumer-focused content, preferably for the web
  • High level of focus and empathy that results in the ability to better understand users’ needs in order to produce concrete and effective content
  • Professional advocate for good content strategy practices internally and with clients
  • Experience analyzing existing content efforts and making relevant recommendations to achieve desired goals
  • Collaborative—possesses the ability to thrive and contribute in a team environment
  • Knowledge of Content Management Systems (e.g., WordPress, Drupal)
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to balance multiple priorities
  • Familiarity with SEO guidelines and keyword research tools (e.g., Moz, Google Keyword Planner)
  • Familiarity with usability best practices and responsive web design

Think Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.
subjects: Other, Data & Analytics, Web Design, Management, Religion & Spirituality, Branding, Strategy, Google

name: Creative Director_30387
description:
About Us – Please allow us to introduce ourselves

Sir Kensington's is a food innovation company, best known for making condiments with character. We work to bring integrity and charm to ordinary and overlooked food. Beginning in 2010, we realized that while food was evolving, condiments weren't. So, we decided to make them better, starting with ketchup. Since then, we launched mayonnaise, mustard, and Fabanaise, and gained a cult following. Now, you can find our condiments in hundreds of leading restaurants, thousands of leading retailers, and millions of meal kit boxes across the country. But we're just getting started. We aim to be America's leading natural condiment brand, and we need your help.
In April of 2017, Sir Kensington’s joined Unilever, the leading progressive global consumer products company. With them, we're part of a family of global brands helping to define the future of good food and good business. With access to Unilever's resources and expertise, we will continue to operate independently from our SoHo headquarters.

About the Role –When you aren’t eating this is what you will do...
Sir Kensington’s is seeking a Creative Director to lead the refinement and expansion of our creative DNA. You will lead the evolution of our brand’s visual identity, and the execution of all creative projects.

You will report to our CMO, working collaboratively with the Marketing and Communications teams to execute across all mediums (digital, print, experiential). You’ll manage our graphic designer as well as creative agency partners to tackle a wide range of projects, from developing a new website (2018-19), to event branding, product launches, and digital campaigns.

Responsibilities:
-Applying systems thinking to solve brand challenges. You understand that with over 50 products and growing, no decision can be made without understanding the implications for the entire system.
-Leading the creative team as we work to evolve our brand. As Sir Kensington’s grows, you’ll help us find the best way to communicate our brand ethos and product attributes through visual design and packaging. 
-Collaborating heavily with marketing and communications. You’ll lead the team for creating packaging, digital assets, social content, recipe content, apparel, and more.
-Dreaming big while never losing sight of the details. You’ll work on large-scale, strategic projects that influence multiple consumer touchpoints and require attention to detail and care.

This role is based in New York City.

About You – Necessary ingredients

The ideal candidate will bring your own skill and taste to the projects at hand. You are proactive in developing new and original ideas, love to problem-solve, have a deep understanding of brand, have a strong eye for typography, and are passionate about design and food. 
You also have:
-An intimate understanding of design, content, and web best practices, including software and file set-up for a variety of production methods. 
-Experience in creative direction with a proven track record in generating new ideas and campaigns
-The ability to create across a variety of mediums with a skill set in digital, print, and environmental / out-of-home design.
-Experience managing a team and meeting deadlines while handling multiple projects at once and collaborating with others.
-No ego when it comes to executing -- we have a small team, and everyone has to be both a thinker and a do-er.
-Comfort giving feedback, navigating multiple points of view, and being able to make decisions as a creative leader.
-An extremely high attention to detail. 
-5+ years of experience working in the field.
-Love for food!

The Special Sauce – Figuratively speaking (though we also make special sauce)
If you're looking for an entrepreneurial, fast-paced startup environment, you'll thrive at Sir Kensington's. But there's more to it than that. If you’re naturally curious and seek to contribute at a purpose-driven food company, you'll feel at home here. We extend Sir Kensington's ethos of "integrity and charm" into the way we work.

-All the condiments (with character) you can eat

responsibility, and candor
-Benefits include health insurance, 401(k), restaurant and wellness stipend,
unlimited snacks, and more.

Sir Kensington’s Mission and Values

Our Mission:
To bring integrity and charm to ordinary and overlooked food.

Our Values:
1— Our secret ingredient is people.
Our work is teamwork. We foster a supportive environment where our team works with a sense of purpose, potential, and play.
2 — We act with honor, even when no one is looking.
We take pride in our work, delivering on our own sense of potential at every
opportunity. Our workmanship is evidence of who we are.
3 — We make condiments with character.
Our products are the most tangible manifestation of our work. They are a
?reflection of our unique philosophy and distinguished by what we call “Kensington Quality.”
4 — We think long term
??We move quickly, but are patient enough to make big things happen. In all parts
?of our business, we build genuine, lasting relationships.

?Equal Opportunity Employment
As Sir Kensington’s first value states, our secret ingredient is people. We seek to recruit
?and include people with a diversity of abilities, backgrounds, and cultures to better serve our diverse community of customers.

??Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities.

Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please see EEO is the Law.

name: Database Architect_30384
description:
Required: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent field of study with an emphasis in database development and or design or 4 years of experience in database development and or design with an advanced level of knowledge of SQL.

  • Analyze science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems. Analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, assist with design and maintenance of workflow diagrams, and scheduling limitations. May analyze or recommend commercially available software.

  • Analyze system requirements to determine required data elements. Identify and document business rules as they apply to database design. Design and develop logical and normalized physical data structures to support system requirements. Design and develop database constraints to support identified business rules and referential integrity requirements. Design and develop database system views, procedures and functions to support application development.

  • Reverse engineer and document existing database designs. Design conflict resolution strategies in a replicating database system. Identify and document database system domain data elements and their requirements. Develop data migration strategies in support of database updates.

name: Design Lead_30422
description:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact candidates on our behalf.

We are looking for a Design Lead to join our team at Think Company in Denver, Colorado.

You should have experience leading major design and user research initiatives, being the client’s primary point of contact, and partnering with multi-disciplinary internal teams. If you love solving problems through an intensely collaborative design process with both clients and colleagues — and can communicate those ideas clearly — you may be our ideal candidate.

Your first project will be focused on the creation of a next generation agent-based customer support system while simultaneously supporting ongoing maintenance and evolution of the existing system.

Our Design Leads serve on project teams by leading the creation of UX deliverables, leading Think Sessions, and overseeing other design activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain positive relationships with clients
  • Strategize and lead competitive and market research efforts
  • Lead and participate in creative brainstorming sessions with clients and internal project teams
  • Clearly and effectively present ideas, research findings, sketches, and other deliverables to clients
  • Design solutions that incorporate current best practices in usability, interaction design, accessibility, and customer service systems
  • Construct compelling narratives for product owner presentations that showcase new products and features to targeted audiences
  • Collaborate with client designers, stakeholders, and developers to build consensus and support
  • Create deliverables from scratch, including sketches, wireframes, workflow diagrams, requirements documentation, user research, usability testing scripts, and discussion guides
  • Conduct needs analyses by synthesizing client discussions, system assessments, user data, and market research
  • Lead UX research and usability testing sessions
  • Direct the team's effort and track their progress through tools such as Kanban-style boards, ticketing systems, etc.
  • Stay up-to-date on current best practices, trends, and technologies in user experience design

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in the UX design field
  • Experience leading projects and teams focused on UX design and research
  • Extreme attention to detail with a focus on efficiency
  • Proven ability to drive project work streams and deliverables with little to no oversight
  • Proven ability to clearly communicate design ideas to team members and clients in live presentations
  • Exceptional client relationship and consulting skills
  • Working knowledge of tools and applications that support UX deliverables, such as wireframes, prototypes, data visualization, and flowcharts

Take a look at our blog and you'll learn that we're a diverse group of designers who love our jobs and have a pretty good time here at work. If you're a talented Experience Designer with a laser focus on the user and work samples that highlight your skills, come think with us.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

name: Digital Advertising Manager_30354
description:
Your Role:

Tenable is seeking a Digital Advertising Manager to join our ecommerce and digital marketing team. This role is responsible for managing multiple digital marketing platforms, including Google AdWords, Bing AdCenter, and LinkedIn Ads. This contributor will work with internal stakeholders to shape the digital marketing plan through media trends and insights and enhance page conversions and overall website optimization to achieve Tenable's business objectives. Candidates must be prepared for a fast-paced environment and be comfortable making decisions.

Your Opportunity:

  • Manage advertising on LinkedIn Ads, SpyFu, BuzzSumo, TradeDesk, and Moz
  • Perform keyword research, keyword management, and bid management
  • Build and test outbound audiences (e.g. interest, in market, direct placement)
  • Build and test retargeting audiences (e.g. product page specific traffic, all prospect traffic)
  • Design outbound and retargeting video ads on Youtube
  • Manage social media advertising through LinkedIn sponsored content, text ads, and inmail

What you'll need:

  • Deep knowledge and previous use of tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture Site Catalyst, Eloqua, and SalesForce
  • Successful track record of providing strategic web and digital recommendations that move the business forward
  • Experience with content, display networks and exchanges are a plus

  • Ability to tell a story with data
  • Ability to build rapport with cross-functional teams

We’re committed to promoting Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) at Tenable - through all equal employment opportunity laws and regulations at the international, federal, state and local levels.

name: Ecommerce Product Manager_30357
description:
About the Role:

Best Made is seeking a Product Manager to lead and project manage our development road map and assist with site updates, strategy, and content. Reporting to the Senior Director of Growth Marketing, the Product Manager will be focused on enabling and supporting customer acquisition and retention efforts through the Best Made website and across the Growth Marketing team, while also ensuring core stability and functionality of our systems. Our mission over the next year is to build platforms that support scalable growth, with a scrappy team, and in a way that creates a delightful customer experience, drives revenue, and supports brand differentiation and growth.

This is a high-visibility role at a fast-growing, innovative brand that is the right fit for someone who can understand the end-to-end implications of feature development and who has superior collaboration skills across a wide variety of cross-functional partners and working styles. The role requires someone who is equally comfortable serving as a customer champion, a high-level strategist, a day-to-day project manager, and a coach/collaborator to partners who may be new to agile product development processes. The person in this role is equally adept at prioritizing and addressing bug fixes, diving into acceptance and testing criteria, as well as strategizing solutions for 6 months to a year from now.

The candidate will work closely with developers, UX designers, and Site Content and Merchandise managers to ensure that our solutions are a good fit for the right market and brand opportunity and support continuous testing and learning of features. You'll also help identify, evaluate, and/or establish key partnerships externally and internally to drive solution expansion as needed.

The ideal candidate is a master of prioritization and cross-functional collaboration, with strong communication and project management skills, a keen sense for end-to-end implications of developments, and a proven track record of getting things done. The ideal candidate is comfortable with data-driven decision making and is also comfortable translating data-driven recommendations for creative, customer or brand focused thinkers. He/she is able to influence and lead partners even when not in a position of direct authority, and loves to think big.

What You’ll Do:

  • Collaborate with Developer and Design teams to identify feature requirements, testing and acceptance criteria, and create a development roadmap
  • Manage backlog of feature requirements, prioritizing features and communicating prioritization and timelines persuasively across teams and stakeholders
  • Develop customer-first oriented growth strategies and serves as a customer champion
  • Collaborate closely with Senior Marketing Manager, Site Content & Merchandising, to ensure the site has capabilities required to support brand and content initiatives as well as merchandising testing and learning
  • Support Planning, Merchandise, Service, and Store Retail in meeting business goals and needs, balancing internal business needs with technologies and customer needs and experience
  • Analyze test and site data to identify key customer pain points and opportunities for refinement, new solutions, and growth
  • Lead introduction of product development methodologies within the company and mentor/coach partners on processes and approaches
  • Support project management initiatives as needed

The Ideal Candidate Has:

  • 5+ years of e-commerce product management
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • An entrepreneurial mentality; willingness to roll up the sleeves and do whatever is necessary to meet goals, and a passion for keeping up with innovations and trends in digital marketing and e-commerce
  • Keen analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases, attention to detail
  • Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple competing priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Proven track record driving innovation on behalf of both enterprises and consumers with a keen ability to prioritize task and to communicate and explain prioritization to multiple stakeholders
  • Experience developing user stories and acceptance criteria and managing a backlog
  • Excellent customer intuition; demonstrated success in creating innovative and user-friendly web services and customer-facing features

Bonus Points For:

  • Experience with both e-commerce and physical retail transactions
  • Experience developing for mobile devices
  • Experience with Netsuite, Shopify Plus, or Solidus
  • Experience across both agile and waterfall development methods

Use the Word to HTML converter to avoid dirty code and messy markup when publishing documents online.

name: Freelance Designer_30376
description:
Freelance Designer for studio that works with nonprofits

Minds On Design Lab is a digital and design team located in Brooklyn, NY that serves as partners to nonprofit organizations. The organizations we work for inspire us everyday with their commitment to making an impact for those they serve. We are thankful and grateful to work with such great clients and are excited to expand our team to continue to offer a high quality service. As a small and effective team, every member, including our freelance support, is critical.

We are looking for a freelance designer to hire on a per project basis. This is a remote position, however if you are near NYC and available for occasional on-site meetings that is ideal.

In the past 6 months our design team has worked on the following:

  • Created digital design concepts that support our Client's organizational and project goals
  • Participated in strategy as it relates to design (i.e. providing feedback on wireframes and site outlines)
  • Website production including adapting designs to work well responsively, rolling out and preparing several pages for hand off to developers
  • Designed print materials for events and marketing materials

  • Ever-developing understanding of the capabilities and limitations of latest web technologies and how that relates to design.
  • Understanding of what makes a good user experience
  • Reliable, able to manage multiple projects and deadlines
  • Ability to work with a small team
  • Can work collaboratively with and can take direction from an Art Director
  • Experience with direct communication with clients and vendors
  • Knowledge of print production (ability to prepare files for printing) is a plus

Requirements:

  • Can produce highly polished digital designs (including small and large scale sites)
  • Proficient in Sketch and the Adobe design suite including Photoshop, illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat
  • Front end HTML and CSS coding experience a plus
  • Print design capabilities are a big plus

To apply: please include ALL of the following:

  • Tell us why you would be a good fit for our team.

name: Graphic Designer/Production Assistant_30372
description:
Are you interested in joining the premier media and events company dedicated to making the world a cleaner more sustainable place for generations to come? Do you want to use your creative chops and instinct for the social good and feel good about going to work every day? GreenBiz Group is looking to add a position to its creative/marketing force to help propagate its visual message and continue to shape and refine its branding presence.

As the GreenBiz Group Graphic Designer/Production Assistant, you will:

  • Report to the Creative Director and work closely with our Marketing, Sales and Editorial departments
  • Help tell the GreenBiz story
  • Assist in asset production for print, web and video
  • Help keep the brand’s visual message consistent and on trend
  • Assist in a strategic branding overhaul across all collateral, as well as ongoing brand maintenance
  • Maintain archival system for all creative assets and event media
  • Help craft the aesthetics of our research projects and reports
  • Help to develop the look and feel of the GreenBiz and VERGE event series
  • Aid the executive producer/director in the live event production
  • Help the marketing team keep our advertising and social presence current with graphics and video

Requirements:

  • 3 + years of professional design experience, either working in-house or with an agency
  • Ongoing proficiency in adobe creative cloud and other creative applications
  • A portfolio that demonstrates a range of experience across different media
  • Ability to conceptualize and sell final concepts to co-workers
  • Be creative, collaborative and interested in proselytizing the GreenBiz message
  • Ability to take direction as well as accept constructive criticism
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Passion for clean, effective design
  • Be fluent in all social media platforms
  • Interest in live event production
  • Willingness to learn and ability to multitask
  • Able and willing to travel on a quarterly basis for our event series
  • Knowledge of video production and post-production a plus
  • Bonus for video editing and motion graphics skills
  • Bonus for experience operating cameras and other AV equipment
  • Passionate about making the world a better place

Our ideal candidate is trend and tech-savvy, possesses excellent communication skills and adheres to a design philosophy where art takes a backseat to communication. You are passionate about design and understand the fundamentals of branding and marketing. You are a team player, an engaged listener, and you value your co-worker's input. You are detail and deadline oriented, with the ability to multitask and manage aggressive delivery schedules. You are able to withstand rigorous production schedules during our events (late nights + early mornings). 

GreenBiz offers full health and dental benefits and a culture that is collaborative, hardworking, and fun. We are located in downtown Oakland, next to BART and AC Transit transportation lines, Frank Ogawa Plaza and tons of great food options! If you are interested, apply here . Candidates will be evaluated on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

 

About us:

GreenBiz Group is a media and events company that views climate change and other global environmental challenges as existential threats to business and society, as well as significant opportunities. We help our audiences understand both, including how to navigate the emerging technologies, business practices, policies and societal expectations that companies, cities and others need to know to succeed. We achieve this through media, events, research and a membership network of corporate professionals. For more information, visit https://www.greenbiz.com/about-us

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

GreenBiz Group values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. GreenBiz Group is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

name: Graphic Designer_30395
description:
We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Graphic Designer to join our dynamic in-house Creative Team. The Graphic Designer is directly responsible for developing print and digital designs as required by Destination DC to reach its goals and fulfill its mission as the official destination marketing organization for the nation’s capital.

 

Destination DC serves as the lead organization to successfully manage and market Washington, DC as a premier global convention, tourism and special events destination, which a special emphasis on the arts, cultural and historical communities.

 

The ideal candidate is an avid doodler who geeks out on illustration, typography and new design technologies, enjoys open collaboration, and possesses a knack for adapting to changing priorities quickly and with a positive attitude. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you will serve on a five-person Creative Team within our Marketing & Communications department, alongside a Senior Designer, Project Manager and Creative Coordinator.

 

 

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  1. Ensure brand consistency while offering fresh and innovative design solutions that push the boundaries and help to shape the Destination DC brand moving forward.
  2. Conceptualize and design a wide range of collateral for marketing, sales and other internal stakeholders based on creative briefs, including but not limited to:
    1. Illustration-heavy projects including mural designs, greeting cards, cartoons/animations, icons, etc.
    2. Promotion-specific media including logos, brochures, promotional items, etc.;
    3. Event-specific media including digital and print invitations, signage, stage décor, tradeshow booth displays, etc.;
    4. Internal branded materials including PowerPoint templates, Word document templates, electronic and print newsletters, sales/promotional kits, meeting and convention trade materials, etc.;
    5. Web-specific materials including headers, ad units and graphics for social media channels and washington.org.
  3. Prioritize multiple running projects with production manager, delivering final deliverables on-brief and on-time.
  4. Interpret and apply design feedback from Senior Graphic Designer, Creative Director and both internal and external stakeholders.
  5. Review final deliverables with an exacting eye, ensuring that graphics and layouts meet the highest standards.
  6. Maintain creative policies and presentation standards, as appropriate to the organization.

 

7.       Other duties as assigned by Creative Director.

 

 

 

Education, Competencies, & Experience

 

1.       Two to four (2-4) years of professional print and digital design experience;

 

2.       Four-year degree from an academic institution in design or relevant field;

 

3.       Expertise in illustration and layout (both print and digital), with motion graphics experience a plus;

 

4.       Demonstrated proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and Powerpoint);

 

5.       Knowledge of print and digital delivery processes and demonstrated ability to prepare print- and digital-ready files for vendors;

 

6.       Understanding of current web standards and UX/UI fundamentals;

 

7.       Ability to juggle multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and work within defined design limits to produce the highest quality material;

 

8.       Capacity to shape and adapt creative and branding created by another professional, when necessary;

 

9.       Solid written and verbal communications skills;

 

10.   Strong attention to detail and time management skills;

 

11.   Video (Premiere Pro CC or Final Cut Pro X) and photo editing experience a plus;

name: Product Design Lead_30363
description:
Who are we?

Thanx helps offline retailers build deeper, data-driven relationships with their best customers by integrating loyalty, feedback, referrals, and personalized marketing tools.

Thanx is backed by some of the best VCs including Sequoia Capital and Icon Ventures. We recently raised a $17.1M Series B to accelerate the company’s growth. We have, since then, grown the team by 250% and seen significant increases in key business metrics including user count, transactions processed, and MRR.

We are in the early stages of growth but well on our way to significant success. We Embrace Diverse Perspectives. We Focus On What Matters. We Make It Happen. We Say “Thanx” Generously. As corny as it may be, we literally say “Thanx” to each other in company all-hands.

Who Are You?

You are a product designer who thrives in a fast-growing startup environment and loves the challenge of building compelling products that people use daily. We’re small but growing, so you should be capable of rolling up your sleeves and pushing pixels and Bézier curves, mocking up user flows, tweaking mobile layouts and dashboard visualizations.

Position Overview:

This role is a partnership between our product management team and our designers to collaboratively develop solutions that make the Thanx product more compelling and effective.

The Product Design Lead creates consistent and compelling user experiences across native mobile apps (iOS and Android), web apps (dashboards, signup flows, etc), email and SMS/MMS, and more. The Product Design Lead creates UIs, data visualizations, icons, illustrations, animations, and everything that goes into the product from wireframe to pixels.

You must:

  • Design applications across platforms that enable users to explore and use our products well
  • Work with our product team to ideate on solutions to opportunities and problems for our customers
  • Work closely with our engineering team to translate your designs into products
  • Produce the entire lifecycle of product design from sketches and whiteboards through wireframes and then to finished designs and design specs and assets for our engineering teams at a fast pace
  • Stay on top of trends and maintain best practices

You have:

  • 5–7 years of product design experience and a portfolio that demonstrates it
  • A proven experience shipping product as a Senior Product Designer, Art Director or equivalent
  • A deep experience across all forms of digital communication platforms from web to mobile to email and beyond
  • Several years of experience shipping software with software developers
  • Hands-on experience with icon design / illustration, typography, user experience, wireframing, interface design, visual design, mobile, responsive web, email, asset production, and specification
  • Experience designing for multivariate testing
  • Ability to take high-level strategic goals outlined by our product team and translate that into user experiences to achieve those goals

Bonus points for:

  • An understanding of the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JS.
  • An understanding of the fundamentals of iOS and Android
  • Familiarity with Agile development process
  • Experience with Git
  • Copywriting/editing skills
  • Experience working in a startup environment

Ready to change your life? Apply now!

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Thanx will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
subjects: Other, Data & Analytics, Mobile Apps, User Experience, Management, Religion & Spirituality, Production

name: Product Designer_30333
description:
DESCRIPTION

Flocabulary is a rapidly growing edtech company that uses music to drive student achievement and foster a love of learning. Students in more than 20,000 schools use our rap songs and interactive learning tools to master academic content. Our product and work reflect our strong belief that a motivated student is a successful student.

The Product Designer will report to our Design Lead. As the third designer to join our growing team, you will have the autonomy to work on important features that shape our product, visual brand and the education of many students. You’ll sit in our Growth & Retention pod, tasked with building our user base and making sure our users are engaged.

Who You Are

You're a designer with a passion for user experience, branding and designing for the web. You care about accessibility and you know when to keep it simple and when to push the boundaries with something more creative. You’re empathetic toward your teammates and in your approach to design. You can zoom out to understand the context, the user story, and the “why”. You're also passionate about the details and keep pushing your work until every last pixel is attended to. You're eager to use your skills to help students and teachers.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with product and engineering to develop new features, improve existing ones, and define long-term plans
  • Create wireframes and prototypes for feedback from internal and external stakeholders
  • Build finalized designs and collaborate with developers to bring them to life
  • Design simple and elegant solutions for complex user experience flows
  • Work with the marketing and sales teams to create and improve product pages and collateral
  • Help to develop and expand the Flocabulary brand
  • Help build the design team’s culture and the voice of design at Flocabulary

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2+ years of experience designing for a web-application or something similar
  • A portfolio that shows both your visual design skills and your approach to problem-solving
  • Strong visual and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with design tools and ability to learn new ones quickly
  • Bonus points for any front-end coding experience

 

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary
  • Fully paid medical, vision, and dental insurance for full-time employees and employer contribution toward dependent care
  • Company stock options
  • Flexible time off and parental leave policies
  • Retirement savings plan (401k) with partial company match
  • Health & wellness stipend
  • Office in Dumbo means easy access to our roof deck, parks and waterfront with postcard views
subjects: Music, User Experience, Design Tools, Branding, Sales

name: Product Designer_30368
description:
Product Designer

This is an amazing opportunity to become a member of our exceptional product design team for a premiere, full-stack software consultancy. DockYard works with ambitious clients across a range of verticals, including: Netflix, Flywheel Sports, McGraw-Hill Education, Zipcar, and more.
We have a holistic approach to product design with an amazing team of designers and engineers. We are looking for someone who enjoys the challenge of making the complex simple and has a passion for the intersection of technology and design.
You are a full-stack product designer. Your workflow includes product discovery, design strategy, wireframing, user journey mapping, iterative prototyping, user research, user testing, and visual design. We take a user-centric approach to solving design challenges and are focused on growing our industry-leading expertise in Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) in 2018 and beyond.
What you’ll do:
  • Design clean, intuitive flows and experiences that excite our clients’ users
  • Bring solid research and discovery practices to inform design and UX solutions
  • Wireframe, prototype, and create hi-fidelity designs
  • Craft beautiful and elegant user-centered solutions
  • Partner with our engineers, UXD, PMs and stakeholders to oversee user experience for products and features from conception to launch
  • Work in solidarity with our customers and other DockYard teams
  • Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with engineers and designers
  • Provide and seek feedback from other designers to always push quality
What we’re looking for:
  • 3+ years of product design experience
  • An excellent communicator who can work well with clients and diverse teams
  • Experience designing and shipping products that customers love
  • Experience with the full-range of product, interaction, and visual design
  • Experience using data to inform design and product decisions
  • Talent in creating and maintaining complex design systems
  • Ability to clearly communicate product strategy, design rationale and conceptual ideas
  • Proficiency with Creative Suite, Sketch, and prototyping tools.
  • A portfolio of top-notch product work that demonstrates strong design and UX skills
DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

We are unable to provide visa sponsorship for this role.

name: Product Designer_30371
description:
Common Networks

Company

Common Networks was founded on the idea that everyone should have a choice for fast, affordabe access to broadband internet. Right now, most homes in the U.S. don't, in fact 62% of homes live in a monopoly broadband market. High-speed access unlocks all the superpowers on the internet. When it works, it can be a great leveling force across the world, giving everyone access to educational tools, entertainment, immediate translations, or even medical care that they wouldn't otherwise have.

Common Networks provides surburban neighborhoods with internet using wireless technology. We interconnect homes in a neighborhood, creating a mesh network between homes and our fiber internet sources. A whole community can then have fast and reliable internet service with only a few  locations needing fiber access.

Role

We are looking to hire our first Product Designer. The primary function of this role is UX/UI design, but this role will also be flexible to do some visual design and marketing design. As the first designer, you will have heavy influence over our overall brand and product experience. We are seeking a designer who can use design thinking, product design, and visual design to help achieve our company-level goals. We care deeply about our customer experience and believe that crafting and honing this experience is what sets us apart from the incumbent ISPs that exist today.

What you do

  • Problem-solve with the product and engineering teams to come up with solutions for problems/challenges across our entire platform
  • Build designs for products and features for a number of different audiences: internal users, field technicians, and our internet subscribers
  • Work cross-functionally with engineers, field operations team, and product managers to implement features
  • You are the voice of design at the company and help to hold us to a high bar of design excellence

Who you are 

  • You care first and foremost about creating an awesome user experience, no matter who the customer is. To that end, you know how to balance aesthetics, functionality and practicality.
  • Design generalist. Your strength is in UX/UI design, however you can also produce visual designs, build marketing templates, and help us think through industrial design of our hardware.
  • Collaborative team member.  You are open, honest, and can respectfully work through difficult problems with the rest of the team.
  • Clear communicator. You have many audiences - engineers, designers, operations team, our board of directores, etc. You know how to structure written and verbal communications clearly for each audience.
  • Creative problem-solver. We are developing technology and a product that has never been built before. You are creative; you generate new, innovative ideas that help us solve problems.
  • Detail oriented. You sweat the small stuff and don't let things slip through the cracks. You understand the difference between letting something slip through the cracks vs. actively deprioritizing an edge case.
  • Naturally curious and have a self-starter personality with hustle. You don't need to wait for people to tell you what to work on. You know that done is better than perfect and are engergized by constantly delivering and moving things forward. You roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to make things successful.
  • Flexible and excited to work in a fast paced, rapidly evolving environment.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of relevant experience
  • Experience designing for desktop and mobile web (bonus for having designed Android apps, print collateral, marketing emails)
  • Experience building designs at varying levels of fidelity - sketches, wireframes, detailed designs and red-lines
  • Excited to work in a rapidly changing startup environment on a team of 20 people to start

*** For consideration, please include a link to your portfolio
subjects: Other, Network & Security, Communications, User Experience, Influence, Media, Hardware, Operations, Design Thinking

name: Product Specialist, Customer Success_30394
description:
Product Specialist, Customer Success

Full-time

—

Tend

Running a diversified farm is complex. Tend is making it simpler by helping farm managers streamline their farming operations. Our aim at Tend.ag is to build the best software available for organic and diversified farmers. You’ll be joining a young company with passionate team that strives to have a long-term major positive impact on the food system.

Opportunity

Tend’s Product Specialist is responsible for working directly with customers as well as our Product Management team. We believe that customer feedback and support has a critical role in the product lifecycle. You will help customers get started and grow in using Tend, answer product questions, track user feedback, report and escalate issues to engineers and act as the bridge between our customers and our Product and Engineering teams. You will also be responsible for writing and coordinating marketing communications sent to our growing customer base. Our office is in Campbell, CA, but remote work is a possibility.

Responsibilities

  • Respond to all customer inquiries in a timely manner (less than 24 hours during the week)
  • Funnel customer feedback up to product managers via regular reports on areas of interest, ad-hoc meetings, and communication in Slack
  • Become an expert in Tend: create help center documentation for key inquiry drivers and video tutorials for main feature areas
  • Triage and file bug tickets for bugs and enhancements
  • Conduct software demos over the computer
  • Organize regular product calls with current customers
  • Write, compile and send marketing and transactional email campaigns and communications
  • Manage customer email lists; segment based on certain attributes or behavior
  • Make updates to Tend.ag
  • Work with product team to compile and send product updates
  • Perform other duties and projects as assigned

About you

  • Have worked with Product and Customer Support teams
  • Supberb attention to detail
  • Are a systems thinker and have experience developing systems for organizing information and reporting
  • Care about and have the ability to deliver a great customer experience
  • Excellent and professional written communication skills
  • Empathy for customer problems and a desire to help solve them
  • Ability to explain complex topics in plain english
  • Knowledge of product development cycle and customer support strategy
  • Interested in technology and agriculture, with an excitement to help influence the future of Tend
  • Experience with product technology: JIRA, Slack, Intercom, and Zendesk, email marketing tools such as Mailchimp/Constant Contact/Sendgrid

Bonus

  • Experience farming, especially on a diversified farm
  • Have worked in a start-up environment
  • Skilled at marketing copywriting

name: QA Analyst (Manual & Automation)_30342
description:
QA Analyst (Manual & Automation)

Who we are

Broadway.com is the leader in Broadway ticketing and news. At Broadway.com the result of your work will be seen and used by millions of people — tourists, theater lovers, students, groups, etc.

We use our creativity to elevate the customer experience, and we test and analyze the customer experience to validate our decisions to ensure the quality of the products we build. We believe in user-centered design principles. We employ the "don't make me think" user experience philosophy.

Our team is passionate, professional, and we all care deeply about our customer experience and the quality of the software that supports it.

 

Opportunity

Broadway.com is seeking a detail oriented and creative QA Analyst to join our team. You'll be a key member in testing, analyzing, and ensuring Broadway.com and our various interactive products meet user experience standards and functional requirements.

This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to join a product team that collaborates early and often throughout the product development lifecycle. You’ll join a collaborative team of product designers, QA analysts, developers, and managers responsible for customer experiences across all our web and mobile products.

You're a creative problem solver. The little things matter - attention to detail is important. Some people would say you're *too* organized. You're self-motivated. You're a terrific communicator, and an excellent writer. You’re passionate about shipping a quality product.

 

Requirements

3+ years Quality Assurance Analyst experience testing web and mobile applications in multiple browsers and across operating systems

Proficient in establishing, documenting and executing test strategies from business and functional requirements

Familiar with Scrum/Agile methodologies and process

Comfortable with Git, Github, gitlab or similar source control solutions

Experience creating automated tests with Javascript and Python

Experience with PyTest, Selenium, BrowserStack, Cypress or similar tools

Experience with Continuous Integration testing tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, etc)

Experience with bug tracking software. We use Jira.

Unix/Linux command-line experience.

Ability to clearly communicate and provide support for the team.

Proven interpersonal, analytical, strategic, and creative problem solving skills.

 

A Day in the Life

If you were working for us, here are some of the things you might have done last week:

Used Jira to review tickets “Ready for QA”, and worked on those tickets towards resolution.

Manual regression testing of a release build.

Prepared to automate regression tests for future iterations.

Tested a release across multiple browsers and operating systems.

Used Selenium to create automated tests for new features, and existing features.

Reviewed a project brief to identify potential test coverage gaps and mitigate risk.

Met with a developer, designer or stakeholder to review requirements for successful test execution, and used this define phase to generate test scripts and documentation.

Proactively looked for gaps in current test coverage and created new test artifacts.

Reviewed and refactored existing test suite to improve readability and documentation.

Used Git to retrieve the latest version of code, and run an instance of a web application to review changes.

Met with Senior QA and staff to review testing strategies, current and future projects and planning.

 

Responsibilities

Apply manual and automated test scripts you generated for the successful release and support of the organization's products.

Generate functional, integration, regression, UAT, and performance/stress tests.

Write detail Test Plan, Test Cases, and Bugs report

Communicate early and often throughout all tasks.

Analyze test results, and document defect/issues in the Jira tracking system.

Collaborate with developers, designers, and stakeholders in the development and maintenance of test artifacts from design documentation and functional specifications.

Proactively troubleshoot with developers, stakeholders, and designers to identify, and resolve issues.

Document defect/issues in Jira tracking system, including relevant brief descriptions of the issue with detailed steps to replicate.

Identify solutions to improve test strategies across products.

Provide regular progress reports of all issues daily and at weekly team status meetings and throughout product iterations, among other things.

 

Nice to haves:

Familiar with Django/Python testing libraries.

Familiar with the Page Object Model pattern.

 

Tools We Use

Jenkins, Gitlab CI

Slack

Invision

Django

Javascript, React/Preact

Sass

Swift

Git

Jira

Amazon Web Services

MySQL

PyTest, Selenium, Cypress, and Browserstack

and many others…

 

We also go to conferences, offer plenty of learning resources, enjoy summer Fridays, and a handful of other fun things we hope to tell you about.

How to Apply:

Email cover letter and resume to hire@broadway.com

Attach your resume to the email. Please send any attachments in PDF format.

Include a link to any public code examples or applications you’ve worked on (websites, Github, etc).

This is not a telecommute job.
subjects: Other, Operating Systems, User Experience, Creativity

name: QA Manager_30389
description:
About Us

Guardhat is more than just a dynamic industrial wearable company - it is leading the charge in industrial safety. Using IoT technologies, Guardhat creates cutting-edge products designed to protect and empower industrial workers globally.

Guardhat is an industrial wearable that blends existing and emerging technologies to protect and empower industrial workers. An intelligent, high tech device, it uses IoT technologies to prevent and minimize human error in the industrial workplace and also helps improve response time in case of an accident or workplace emergency. Beyond safety, the Guardhat open platform is capable of additional applications that involve real-time access to front line workers.

 

About the role

Using prior quality and engineering experience, develop, implement and manage quality systems consistent with established standards, our customer specifications and production goals.  Manage the part qualification process and perform various project management activities.

 

  • Develop a QA scheduled plan for achieving ISO 9001, IECEx (QAR) and ATEX (QAN) compliance for Guardhat’s products and required partners
  • Develop and implement training plans for the required teams
  • Perform internal audits and address non-conformances in a timely manner.
  • Prepare organization for ISO 9001 audits and maintain ISO standards as required.
  • Prepare organization for IECEx (QAR) and ATEX (QAN) audits and maintain respective standards as required.
  • Ensure engineering and manufacturing process is consistent with ISO, QAR and QAN as required to achieve certification as scheduled
  • Approve and manage document control process and configuration management systems.
  • Oversee and manage test equipment calibration and other relevant programs for quality assurance
  • Provide project management support as necessary.

The Ideal Candidate Has

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or a related technical field, and 5+ years of relevant QA experience.
  • Lean Manufacturing Techniques - Six Sigma Black Belt
  • A demonstrated track-record of accomplishments as an efficient Quality Assurance Manager (5 years+ establishing QA programs)
  • Experience with US and international Quality Systems’ regulations, including planning and implementation.
  • Demonstrated experience conducting audits and creating/executing corrective action plans
  • Excellent communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and organizational abilities.
  • Ability to take initiative, to create efficient process, to meet deadlines, and to work in a diverse and distributed team environment.
  • Ensure a high level customer service, internal and external to quickly assess and address issues relating to quality.
  • Organize and analyze statistical data and product specifications to determine standards and to establish quality and reliability expectancy of finished products.
  • Demonstrated experience interpreting and relaying quality control philosophy to key personnel within company.
  • Experience in developing and implementing quality control training programs.
  • Ability to set goals and achieve scheduled deadlines
  • Experience with product certifications: FCC/UL/CE/ETSI
