name: Quality Assurance / Software Business Analyst_30397
description:
About us

What’s most important to you?  A great place to work? A stable, successful company?  Or making a meaningful impact?

 

How about all of the above?

 

As an amazing place to work, we’re one of Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers according to the Globe and Mail. You can also check us out on Glassdoor :)

 

Success? Yes, please! inFlow has dominated the desktop inventory software market with over a million downloads and now we’ve expanded by taking it to the cloud and mobile. We’ve been profitable since the beginning in 2007, and we’re one of Canada’s fastest growing businesses according to the PROFIT 500 list.  

 

Impact? Check! As the 23rd member of our team, you would be instrumental in shaping how our software helps tens of thousands of small businesses compete and thrive.

 

We’ve got an amazing group of talented and friendly people here, and we’re looking for world class talent, like you, to join us!

 

Check us out at www.archonsystems.com!

 

Some of our job benefits

  • Work from home 2-3 days a week (wait, what?)
  • Work from our beautiful Toronto office on office days
  • Company-sponsored lunches once a month at great restaurants
  • Top-notch computers.  We hate slow computers too!
  • All-expense-paid conferences
  • Health and dental benefits
  • Make a difference: you'll be the 23rd member of our tight-knit team

Job Description

In a nutshell, you’ll be the bridge between code and meeting people’s needs.

 

This role is a hybrid between traditional QA and software business analyst roles.

 

You’ll ensure that our software continually helps customers more by deeply understanding their needs. You’ll also help to question and improve software designs while testing, in order to catch problems early on.  

Responsibilities

  • Dig into customer feedback to get a deeper understanding of their needs
  • Test new software updates
  • Work with software designers and developers, help design the product features and make sure updates ship quickly with high quality
  • Pre-release manual software testing to find what might have broken, alongside our automated tests
  • Clearly communicate details of software updates to our customer support and marketing teams
  • Understand the software architecture and dig into logs and SQL databases to get to the root of the problem

Requirements

  • Familiarity with technical troubleshooting (e.g., SQL, REST APIs, browser consoles, log files, etc.)
  • The ability to quickly understand broad concepts across people, processes, software design, and software development considerations
  • The drive and courage necessary to ask challenging questions and work with multiple people to push for change
  • Detail oriented thinking and a critical eye to catch problems
  • The ability to look at a problem from all angles and suggest the best solution, making appropriate tradeoffs
  • Clear and concise communication skills
  • 1+ years experience working with agile software development

Nice to have (but not necessary)

  • Experience working closely with user interface designers and/or user experience specialists
  • Experience working closely with software developers
  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent hands-on experience
  • Experience with software test automation
  • Experience with small business inventory management
  • A healthy sense of impatience
  • Bonus points if you find any bugs in this job posting ;)

What are you waiting for?

To apply, go to this webpage

 

  • http://bit.ly/archon-qa-ba-mar-2018

 

(Please complete by March 22nd, 2018).

description:
The Brigade is a digital agency with a passion for user-centered design, great art and formidable technology.  We create remarkable digital products and experiences.

name: Senior Frontend Engineer_30338
description:
We're looking for a senior frontend engineer that cares deeply about building beautiful, functional frontend experiences while working collaboratively with designers, product managers, and backend engineers. This engineer will focus on developing a cohesive frontend architecture that provides our customers with a great experience customizing their sample box and providing insightful brand feedback. name: Senior Full Stack Engineer_30364
description:
Who are we?

Thanx helps offline retailers build deeper, data-driven relationships with their best customers by integrating loyalty, feedback, referrals, and personalized marketing tools.

Thanx is backed by some of the best VCs including Sequoia Capital and Icon Ventures. We recently raised a $17.1M Series B to accelerate the company’s growth. We have, since then, grown the team by 250% and seen significant increases in key business metrics including user count, transactions processed, and MRR.

We are in the early stages of growth but well on our way to major success. We Embrace Diverse Perspectives. We Focus On What Matters. We Make It Happen. We Say “Thanx” Generously. As corny as it may be, we literally say “Thanx” to each other in company all-hands.

Who are you?

You love building products that change the world. You enjoy using technology to solve real-world problems. You are not afraid to ask “why?”, dig deep, and “Make It Happen.” You take joy in the process of software craftsmanship.

You are passionate. Passionate about creating high-quality software and not settling for less, passionate about full stack engineering, and passionate about the team you work with. That passion energizes you.

You invest in people. You recognize you're part of a whole. You learn from others, teach those around you, and truly care about the people you work with.

You are a leader. You lead by example - you find problems and you take action.

What about the team?

Our engineering team is driven, collaborative, and curious. Whether it’s working on a complex technical problem, ideating a feature, or trying to get out of an escape room - we work together. We are builders who love solving real-world problems by creating high-quality software and not settling for less. Don’t worry, we have fun too! Some of us are serious foodies so recommendations are welcome!

You must:

  • Work with product and design teams
  • Build features end-to-end
  • Work on internal tools to make yourselves and your peers happier and more effective
  • Work on infrastructure to make our systems highly-available, scalable, and performant

You have:

  • Created high-quality software from end to end for at least 2 years, no less
  • Expertise with Ruby on Rails or similar web application frameworks

name: Senior Graphic Designer (Marketing)_30418
description:
Overview

We are looking for a full-time Senior Graphic Designer to work with our award-winning creative team. Daily projects include designing marketing emails, planning and creating content for social, and collaborating with the team on larger marketing initiatives. This position reports into our Design Director and works closely with our Creative Director, the Marketing team, and other graphic designers.

Responsibilities

  • Create dynamic graphics and layouts for homepages, emails, social, banner ads, and events while considering brand, user, and business needs
  • Collaborate with Design Director and Copywriter to come up content ideas for emails and social

  • Strong knowledge of typography and grid systems
  • Deep understanding of Adobe programs
  • A collaborative attitude and willingness to be flexible and accommodating in our fast-paced environment
  • Strong communication and project management skills with a strength in managing multiple deadlines
  • Hard work ethic, desire to learn and grow

name: Senior Product Designer_30336
description:
Goldstar loves live entertainment (both watching it and participating in it!) and we want to make it easy for our members to love it too. We are looking for a like-minded Product Design Lead to join our team and help us rethink the process of live-event ticketing from top to bottom. 

There are a truckload of exciting changes coming to Goldstar and we want you to be right there with us as it happens! We're not a start-up, but we're still entrepreneurial. We're an established leader, but still scrappy and innovative. And with 120+ employees, we're not-too-big yet not-too-small — and still growing.

Designers play an important role at Goldstar—from helping to concept and realize new features all the way through to perfecting final details in the product. Our design team integrates with cross-functional teams in all parts of our business, and directly with the rest of our ~40 person product team. We’ve built a culture that is focused on collaboration and are looking for a designer who believes that great design happens in an open environment. 

The product team is based in our Portland, Oregon office. We're excited to help relocate the right person (within the U.S.), but we're not really into telecommuters right now. Most of all, we're looking for someone who knows how to ship and support world-class experiences for millions of people.
subjects: Arts & Crafts

name: Senior Product Designer_30405
description:
The Atlantic is looking for someone to join our product design team which focuses on the user experience, interactions, and UI for our digital products. The ideal candidate’s experience is rooted in established design principles, and champions best practices and industry standards. You will need to know when to apply established patterns and styles, as well as when to evolve them. You will identify and help correct product inconsistencies, on both the visual and experience sides. Most importantly, you will create beautiful and usable interfaces that help our editorial team tell their stories.

What you will do

  • Work on the entire lifecycle of the product: research, prototyping, high fidelity comps, and collaborate with engineers on implementation.
  • Collaborate with product managers, developers, editors and other designers.
  • Help us evolve and expand our design system, affectionately called Hippo.
  • Balance the needs of the editorial team, the business, and the user.
  • Work on both customer facing interfaces as well as internal tooling.
  • Contribute to the growth of your junior colleagues by providing feedback, leading critiques, and elevating the output of the team.
  • Identify opportunities for improvement in our products and process and take the initiative to provide solutions.

What we are looking for

  • You have 5+ years of relevant experience
  • You’ve designed and shipped mobile and web products. Experience specific to media or publishing is a plus.
  • You enjoy both details of the craft and deliberate, long-term systems thinking. You enjoy perfecting typography just as much as creating a component library.
  • Demonstrate and articulate an understanding of layout, typography and visual hierarchy, coupled with user centered design and best practices.
  • Software expertise with Sketch, Illustrator, and Photoshop. Experience using wireframe and prototyping tools, such as Invision, Omnigraffle, Framer, or Principle. A solid understanding of HTML and CSS. Coding experience is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills: can brainstorm with a group, articulate ideas, and tease out feedback from colleagues.
  • Enthusiasm for The Atlantic and a desire to contribute to the growth of our design culture.

 

To Apply

Candidates must apply with a link to an online portfolio that shows 5+ examples of product design. Candidates without an online portfolio or web-specific examples will not be considered.

 

About The Atlantic Product Team

The Product team is a relatively small, friendly bunch of folks, including the SVP and general manager of TheAtlantic.com, product directors and managers, platform and front-end engineers, and the product design team. We work closely together, meet frequently and promote discussions that encourage new ideas and critical thinking. We have bagels on Thursdays and drinks on Fridays.

 

Atlantic Media Values:
Across Atlantic Media, generally, the firm looks for two “pillar gifts” in you, and everyone else.  In all of us, these are more aspirational than actual, but they are central in our intentions –

Force of Ideas:  At the center of Atlantic Media work are the ideas within our writing.  We believe that ideas – to the good and not – have consequence.  Our highest work is bringing rigor, insight, intellectual honesty, to that ultimate purpose of separating the bad from the good, and giving voice to the latter.
Spirit of Generosity:  Atlantic Media seeks in its ranks a spirit of generosity – a natural disposition in each colleague toward service and selfless conduct.  Atlantic Media writing should be cut from the same cloth –critical on the merits but informed by charity and forbearance in measuring motive and personal character.


Atlantic Media is an EOE of Minorities/Women/Vets/Disability.
subjects: Other, User Experience, Media, Fitness, Industry

name: Senior Product/UX & UI Designer_30341
description:
We’re looking for a senior product designer to join our team and help bring our product vision and strategy to life. The right candidate for this role must be passionate about designing experiences and interfaces at the intersection of beautiful, delightful and useful. We’re looking for someone who has a deep appreciation for the mixture of beauty and strategy that comes together in user experience design and evangelizes that in their daily work. The best candidates for this role look to research—both qualitative and quantitative—to guide their design process. An iterative, customer-centric approach to user experience design is pivotal for this role. Given the collaborative nature of this role—and the natural tendency of design to garner lots of feedback—the best candidates for this role will have top-notch interpersonal skills and able to build trust with stakeholders, engineers and product managers alike. Finally, we’d love a candidate with frontend coding skills or an interest in developing them!

Responsibilities

  • Participation at various levels in the complete product development lifecycle from definition through design, research, testing, development, and QA.
  • Conduct and participate in research and user testing to explore requirements, users’ needs and validate the results of your work.
  • Balance the needs of the customer with those of the business.
  • Create and maintain documentation and deliverables surrounding the product, including design files as well as presentations and style guides.
  • Work collaboratively with stakeholders, product managers, and engineers to solve problems through innovative visual and interactive solutions.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of design experience across mobile and web.
  • A diverse portfolio of design experience including prototype/wireframing, UX, visual and interaction design.
  • A strong foundation in aesthetics (typography, photography, composition, color, hierarchy, etc.)
  • Experience with user research including online user testing and phone/in-person interviews.
  • Experience designing for targeted growth and optimization.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written that pair well with an ability to articulate your thought, decision, and design processes.
  • An ability to build trust with stakeholders and collaborators, challenge beliefs and assumptions, and deliver feedback with grace and respect.
  • A proven track record of successfully shepherding projects from conception to launch.
  • Extremely detail oriented and well organized.
  • Ability to be productive independently while staying integrated with the larger product and engineering teams.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills including excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Fluency in Sketch or the Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Coding experience is a huge plus, but not a distinct requirement.
  • A bachelor’s degree or comparable work experience.

This is an on-site role. Applicants must be living in or intending to move to the greater NYC metropolitan area.
subjects: User Experience, Leadership, Strategy

name: Senior Rails Engineer_30340
description:
We’re looking for a senior software engineer that cares deeply about building great systems and products from beginning to end. Our continually growing membership leads to “flash sale”-like traffic that requires us to build and engineer systems that are well-built, reliable and performant. The perfect engineer for this role is one who has had significant experience building applications for public consumers at scale. This engineer is a Ruby on Rails expert who is always looking to grow their skill set. Adherence to best practices, a strong approach to testing and a tenacious spirit are key characteristics of this engineer. This role is best suited for someone who is looking to help build and mentor other engineers and in time, grow into a lead role.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop and maintain our core operational systems utilizing clean, maintainable code.
  • Help to plan, oversee and implement new features within our product and systems.
  • Partner with product managers, designers and QA engineers to bring life to new features and products.
  • Utilize monitoring and logging to improve the quality and speed of our codebase.
  • Evangelize best practices within the engineering groups.
  • Help to develop our internal processes and tools as we move towards a fully automated CI/CD process.
  • Perform and participate in code reviews and “lunch and learns” to foster training and development across the team.
  • Provide mentorship and support to junior team members.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of professional Ruby & Rails experience with a proven track record of successful projects.
  • Expert working knowledge of Ruby, Rails & JavaScript.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming best practices and design patterns.
  • Strong familiarity with data stores — we use MySQL, Redis, Memcached, and Elasticsearch.
  • Significant experience building, scaling and supporting web applications both internal and consumer-facing.
  • Comfortable being productive independently while staying integrated with the larger engineering team.
  • Experience working with Git and GitHub (specifically working with pull requests).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Desired

  • Experience working with an agile team.
  • Familiarity with React, Redux or GraphQL is a big positive.
  • Knowledge working with data pipelines (we use Amazon Kinesis) and data & BI platforms (we utilize TreasureData, Amazon Red Shift, Amazon Lambda and Chart.io).
  • Experience with service-oriented architectures.
  • Familiarity with AWS or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Experience doing DevOps work (we utilize Ansible, Terraform and aim to use Kubernetes in the future).

This is an on-site role. Applicants must be living in or intending to move to the greater NYC metropolitan area.

name: Senior Software Developer_30420
description:
meltmedia is looking for a Senior Software Engineer who is passionate about solving complex client problems and mentorship of fellow developers. This person should be fluent in Java, system integrations, and teamwork.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be expected to take lead on the projects and teams with which you work. Code quality and Client Satisfaction should always be on the forefront of your mind. You will be involved in both application development as well as architectural decisions. We look for our Senior Engineers to drive meltmedia’s technical vision. You strive and push others to achieve outstanding results and are a role model for your team and meltmedia at large. We work closely with our Project Managers and clients to deliver software that meets their needs and the needs of their users.

You will be expected to learn new technologies and teach it to other developers in a timely fashion. You should enjoy mentoring other developers and seek to help them grow on a daily basis.

Senior Software Engineers at meltmedia build our technical roadmap, lay the groundwork for other developers, and support a team of peers through everyday agency challenges. They’re the highest authorities in the department and on occasion, ride horseback through the office. Senior Engineers are expected to balance their project work with the growth of their teams and the future of the technology department. It’s a role with huge potential for impact, so if you want to help steer us to the future, this is the gig.

Qualifications

  • Thorough understanding of web systems architecture and the application thereof.
  • Strong understanding and applicable experience with RESTful services.
  • Extensive experience with engineering Java applications is a must.
  • Extensive experience with engineering web applications is a must.
  • Experience with engineering NodeJS applications is a plus.
  • Comprehensive understanding and applicable experience with testing theory and application.
  • Experience and comfortability working directly with clients.
  • Experience with OSGi, JCR and Adobe Experience Manager is a plus.
  • Experience with client side technologies is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of the SDLC from requirements to delivery and support.
  • Experience working with a cross discipline team.

name: Senior Software Engineer JavaScript_30343
description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in the continental U.S. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.

Why We Started Very

Not to oversimplify things, but our mission is to become the best IoT, blockchain, and machine learning product development shop in the world. We do this by hiring the best and investing heavily in them, both personally and professionally.

We Fully Embrace Working Remotely

About 30% of our team works out of our HQ in Chattanooga, TN, and the other 70% work remotely from various locations across the United States. We consider ourselves best-practitioners of the remote-first movement and believe a great team shouldn’t be restricted by geography.

What You’ll Be Working On

Very is first and foremost a software consultancy, we tackle hard problems for clients who need a targeted, senior team to come in and provide specific solutions. We are focusing heavily on building out products that have applications in one of the three following areas: 1) data science & machine learning, 2) Internet of Things, and 3) blockchain. We’ve found that in each of these areas, the use of the underlying technology will drive the development of the core services , but that 75% of the work often still lives in the realm of modern web development.

At Very, there is a never ending supply of variety to the types of projects we work on. In the last year we’ve built solutions that touch e-commerce, trust management (finance), beer distribution, point of sale systems, ICO’s, identifying fake news, and much more.

You’ll spend 80% of your week (Monday through Thursday) designing and building a product or platform for one of our clients. The other 20% of your week (Friday) will be spent contributing to our open source projects, internal products, learning, teaching, and participating in internal operations of all flavors.

Project teams are small and usually made up of one or two pairs of engineers, a UX engineer, a product manager, and the client who serves as the product owner. We spend most of our time building new products, with the goal of helping our clients take it to market. We are often further engaged by our clients to continue iterating on the product once it is live. The high cost of context switching is real, so we do our best to keep teams together throughout the duration of their projects (typically 3-6 months), but have found it valuable to rotate pairing partners when it makes reasonable sense.

We are always exploring new tools, languages, and technologies. We feel strongly that it’s a good idea to use the best tool for the job and not see everything as a nail. We also try our best to standardize our technology and tooling across project teams so it’s easier to rotate and practice collective code ownership. We are currently building products and platforms using the following tools / platforms:

  • React & React Native

  • Swift & Objective C

  • Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves

  • Arduino (embedded C/C++)

  • Ethereum / Solidity

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Python

  • Pandas

  • Serverless

  • AWS (and a dash of Heroku where it makes sense)

Given that we work on quite a bit of greenfield projects, there is often room to experiment with new patterns and tools (within reason). We don’t expect applicants to know our entire toolchain, but rather to be capable, flexible, and self-directed.

This Role: Senior Software Engineer // Javascript

Over the past few years, we’ve seen client-side engineering emerge as its own discipline, and we are looking for individuals who thrive in the front end and want to further their practice. Ideal candidates not only have a solid engineering background, but a passion for client-side development as well.

We value well-tested, reusable code and expect our engineers to be as good of practitioners as they are leaders and teachers.

How We Operate

We are believers in transparency and openness. In terms of organizational structure and governance, we are a holacracy. It’s worked pretty well for the us the last few years. When it comes to development processes, we do our best to adhere as closely to Extreme Programming as possible. We believe in hiring capable, responsible professionals. We don’t micromanage and trust everyone to work hard, experiment, learn from their mistakes, and contribute to each other and the company in a sustainable manner. We have no venture funding or external investors, which affords us the ability to be nimble and run our company in the best interest of our team as a whole.

How You’ll Be Compensated

We believe in a transparent, fair compensation structure and have developed our own open salary formula. Depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $80,000 and $135,000 upon joining the company. We have many health plans available through UHC—prices and plans vary based on your region—as well as vision and dental. We currently contribute a large portion to each plan, again, amounts vary based on region. As an added benefit, Very provides 1X Earnings Basic Life & AD&D. We have a 401k program that we’ll provide a 2% match on after a few months working with us. Lastly, 35% of the company’s ownership is reserved for a team member options pool.
subjects: Web Development, Other, Data & Analytics, Finance, Management, Operations, E-Commerce, Google

name: Senior UI Designer_30337
description:
We’re looking for a talented visual designer to help us enhance our growing collection of digital behavioral health tools and apps. This role would work collaboratively with Product, Engineering, and UX in our Denver office to produce engaging, impactful, and usable interfaces for our mobile products and web app. If you enjoy designing thoughtful solutions to meaningful challenges for a diverse range of users, we’d love to hear from you.

ABOUT US

myStrength is transforming how behavioral healthcare is provided by developing solutions which bring together the best of human support with digital capabilities in a unique way. myStrength is developing innovative, evidence-based tools and applications for depression, anxiety, substance abuse and many other behavioral health challenges. These web and mobile resources are highly personalized and engage the whole person (mind, body, spirit) in a way that is hopeful, upbeat and fun.

ON ANY GIVEN DAY YOU COULD FIND YOURSELF:

  • Designing our brand new native mobile apps (Android and iOS)
  • Creating wireframes and sketches of new ideas and features
  • Illustrating empty states or designing unique content within our apps
  • Working closely with our Creative Director, Product, UX, and Engineering teams on UI implementation and user experience.
  • Enhancing the myStrength brand and ensuring color, style, iconography and typography in our product, website and marketing materials follow same guidelines.
  • Speaking with various stakeholders and teams throughout the organization to understand user pain points and find solutions.
  • Ensuring WCAG 2.0 compliance for everything you create within the product

YOU SHOULD HAVE:

  • A strong foundation in designing native mobile apps, both iOS and Android.
  • Experience in designing consumer facing web applications
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills, and can present your work and effectively communicate how your designs solve specific problems.
  • A passion to build accessible products that are visually delightful and easy to use
  • Amazing skills with design software such as Illustrator, Sketch, Adobe XD, and Photoshop. You’re free to use what you feel is the best tool for the task at hand.
  • Ability to receive feedback and design critiques in a thoughtful and professional manner

BONUS POINTS (nice to have but not required):

  • Experience with animation or motion graphics
  • Comfortable rolling your own HTML, CSS and crafting responsive interfaces.
  • Experience with Statamic CMS and designing marketing sites

YOU’LL FIT RIGHT IN IF

  • You over-communicate to stakeholders and the business by nature
  • You love witty banter
  • You want to change people’s lives and help others
  • You are self–directed but play well with others
  • You’re honest and ethical
  • You continually strive to learn new things

OTHER DETAILS

  • Located in Downtown Denver, CO with great views of the mountains
  • Full Time, with Work-life balance – we don’t expect you to sleep at your desk
  • Work mostly on-site with ability to work remote when necessary
  • Compensation package commensurate with experience and expertise
  • Benefits include:
    • 401k plan
    • Company-sponsored health insurance, ST/LT disability and Life insurance
    • Subsidized parking
    • Oh yeah, we also have a stocked fridge and great snacks
subjects: Other, Mobile Apps

name: Senior UX Designer_30331
description:
Job Description
Position Overview:
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior User Experience Designer to join our growing team based out of our New York City office.
Working closely with other team members, you will design and implement high quality, polished graphics, interfaces, and promotional materials for both front-facing and backend web sites, advertisements, and external mobile applications.
You will work closely with the Founder, Head of Product, and Head of Marketing.
Responsibilities:

Build great user experiences for mobile (native and web), desktop for consumer facing products
Design modern web interfaces (multiple breakpoints)
Develop graphics from concept through to completion (and measurement)
Create and/or apply brand identity standards across media
Create compelling visual designs used in multi-faceted marketing campaigns

Skills & Experience:

3-5 years of experience with digital and graphic design for web and mobile
Ability to create content from scratch using current assets
Ability to create mobile layouts and app interfaces for iOS and Android
Experience with responsive web design and a solid understanding of user-centered design required
Technical expertise in the development of design, prototyping and motion
Strong layout, color and typography skills
Strong working knowledge of Sketch, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and/or associated design tools (Zeplin, Invision, etc.)
Strong HTML/CSS with some Javascript nice to have

Personal Qualities:

Strong interpersonal skills, highly motivated, enthusiastic and dynamic with the ability to work effectively in a team
You obsess over details and your work is pixel-perfect
Strong oral and written communication
Passion for the craft and love of technology and a self-starter

Additional Requirements:

Must be in the NYC area.
Must be eligible to work in the US immediately.

About Masterworks
Masterworks allows you to invest in great masterpieces.
Similar to investing in the stock market, we allow you to invest and trade in great artworks by 20th century masters like Picasso, Monet, Warhol, and more.
Masterworks was founded in 2017 by technology and art-world entrepreneurs, who have over 100 years of combined experience in both industries. It is the first company to offer registered securities in great works of art, allowing investors to buy and trade in specific paintings valued above $10 million each.

name: Senior UX Designer_30423
description:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact people on our behalf.

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our team at Think Company in Denver, Colorado.

Think Company is looking a designer to join an established systems design team. As a member of this team, you will help to evolve and refine existing initiatives, while also contributing to the development of future strategic design decisions for our client's customer support system. In applying for this job, you should have a strong grounding in foundational interaction design principles, portfolio pieces demonstrating your ability to design for complex systems, and an innate interest in shaping our connected world.

Core Responsibilities

  • Work collaboratively on creative teams that include both clients and internal colleagues
  • Proactively drive work forward, seeking direction when necessary and taking initiative when appropriate
  • Design solutions that incorporate modern usability and interaction design practices
  • Define the information architecture and interaction design standards to which this system will adhere
  • Conduct needs analyses by synthesizing client discussions, system assessments, contextual inquiries, user data, and other research findings
  • Create deliverables from scratch with little to no oversight, including:
    • Sketches
    • Wireframes
    • Site maps
    • Workflow diagrams
    • Requirements documentation
    • User research and usability testing scripts and discussion guides
  • Lead competitive landscape and market research efforts
  • Lead UX research and usability testing sessions
  • Clearly and effectively present ideas, research findings, sketches, and other deliverables to clients
  • Collaborate effectively with development teams
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with clients
  • Lead and participate in creative brainstorming sessions with clients and internal project teams
  • Stay up to date on current themes, trends, and technologies in user experience design

Preferred Requirements

  • Portfolio of work demonstrating experience designing for complex systems on multiple platforms, including mobile
  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in the UX design field
  • Uncommon attention to detail with a focus on efficiency
  • Track record of driving project work streams and deliverables
  • Proven ability to clearly communicate design ideas to team members and clients in live presentations
  • Proficiency with tools and applications that support UX deliverables, such as wireframes, prototypes, and flowcharts (e.g., Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud, InVision)
  • Experience working within teams that create and use well-defined visual design systems or pattern libraries
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Bonus Points

  • Working knowledge of basic principles of visual design
  • Working knowledge of basic principles of content strategy

Sound compelling? Feel like a match? We’d love to hear from you! To help the process along, tell us a bit about yourself and share some samples of your best design work.

Take a look at our blog and you'll learn that we're a diverse group of designers who love our jobs and have a pretty good time here at work. If you're a talented Experience Designer with a laser focus on the user and work samples that highlight your skills, come think with us.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
subjects: Other, Data & Analytics, User Experience, Religion & Spirituality, Arts & Crafts, Strategy, Landscape

name: Senior iOS Engineer_30335
description:
Fuzz is seeking a **Senior iOS Engineer** to join our team. The right person will partner with senior leadership and with a team of designers, engineers, and product managers. Fuzz provides a collaborative workspace that promotes a supportive learning environment and innovation.


The team has weekly meetings and monthly internal education sessions that promote topics and technologies designed to enhance the knowledge of the individual and the team.

Minimum requirements:

* Extensive iOS app experience (Must have 2+ years full time.)
* 2 years total of professional development experience with degree in Computer Science.
* ...or 4 years total of professional development experience.


The ideal candidate:


* has extensive knowledge of core Computer Science concepts, including Object-Oriented programming, multi-threading, MVC, etc.
* has significant experience architecting and designing applications
* has experience using source control and bug tracking software such as Git and Jira.
* leverages industry best practices for quality code, including unit tests, automated UI tests, API stubs/mocks, etc.
* has profound and broad knowledge of the iOS SDK
* cares about producing responsive, beautiful UIs and keeps abreast the latest UIKit components and practices
* is experienced with a wide breadth of data storage techniques, including Core Data, Sqlite, NSCoding serialization, iCloud, etc.
* understands API interactions from end-to-end, particularly with RESTful APIs.


Additionally, candidates should be:


* a natural problem solver and leader
* deeply concerned with product and code quality
* experienced at leading and serving as a resource to a team of developers (code reviews, managing deadlines).
* comfortable interacting directly with clients and conveying technical concepts clearly via non-technical language.



Fuzz is dedicated to hiring a diverse and highly skilled talent base and as such is committed to EEO practices. Fuzz provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.*

name: Software Developer_30373
description:
Do you get excited about scaling, securing, and maintaining systems, so that our clients and our team have the tools they need, when they need them? Does troubleshooting, tinkering, and designing solutions to improve and monitor performance get you out of bed in the morning? Do you love to develop new features and build new products for a growing organization that makes a difference in people’s lives? Precision Nutrition is looking for an experienced developer who doesn’t just have a passion for building killer features, but also cares about maintaining and improving the overall health of our platform and infrastructure.

Who You Are

You balance the demands of product development, with the need to scale our growing user base. You can work anywhere in the stack: you mess with javascript for breakfast, write a new RESTful API endpoint in Rails for a mid-morning snack, tune a query in Postgres for lunch, and write an Ansible cookbook for dinner. You share our belief that every developer takes ownership of our production environment and isn’t above operations work.

We know this is a tall order and requires a special person to do it right. If this sounds intriguing to you, read on.

What You Get to Do

Ruby/Rails API development. Our coaching platform is backed by a RESTful API implemented in Rails. You’ll spend a lot of your time building, testing, and working with Rails. We’re using Elixir and Phoenix too, so come prepared to learn!

Ember. Our front-end devs are focused on working with our suite of Ember, user-facing applications - but it really helps if you can see the big picture and understand our stack front to back. That means learning Ember.js and Ember Data. Don’t worry - you’ll have lots of help. We’ve got a team of Ember experts to show you the ropes.

DevOps. You’ll write reliable, scripted means of deploying code and system changes (today we use Ansible, yet we’re open to trying new tools). You’ll maintain provisioning and continuous integration systems, keep system software up to date, and ensure code can be deployed and rolled back easily and reliably, while making sure backups are behaving, and security best practices are being followed.

Monitor performance.You’ll design and execute performance tests on our website and other applications, as well as recommend and implement system and application performance best practices.

Maintain our systems. You’ll monitor the health of all systems, participate in our on-call rotation team, and respond to, and escalate infrastructure issues. You’ll perform regular and ad hoc sysadmin tasks on all shared systems, and manage Amazon Web Services and other hosting service providers. You’ll schedule and manage site downtime, and work with the team to proactively add infrastructure so that our clients and team have the best experience possible.

Our Ideal Candidate

Is experienced. You have at least 5 years of experience in a Development or DevOps role in an Agile environment. You know, or are excited to learn, Ruby on Rails, Ember, and maybe even some Elixir/Phoenix, as well as the usual tools of the trade: Amazon Web Services such as EC2, S3 and RDS, Ansible, Vagrant, Linux, PostgreSQL, Continuous Integration, and Redis.

Is on the cutting edge. In your spare time, you research and stay up to date on the latest and greatest best practices, systems, and tools.

Likes variety. You'll be wrangling all kinds of systems, apps, and technologies - everything from our Wordpress-based sales sites to our modern Ember/Rails based coaching platform and our next generation Elixir based payment processing system.

Can easily switch gears. You have the ability to prioritize and re-prioritize your work in a changing environment - you understand that things change as new information is made available. You don’t mind managing multiple projects and have the ability to have a few balls up in the air at one time.

Cares. You take care of our data and systems like they are your very own.

Is self-motivated and can work independently. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don’t need a lot of direction. You are highly organized and always eager to learn more and share with the team.

Leaves their ego at the door. You have integrity, talent, are outgoing, have a palpable excitement about the future, and don’t show it off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, and excessive "constructive criticism" are out.

Is resilient and has a growth mindset. Part of open, honest communication is having the ability to deliver honest, direct feedback without being offensive or critical. The other part is having the ability to view honest, direct feedback as a gift you can use to get better. If you’re married to your ideas or are (even mildly) offended when they’re challenged, this probably won’t be a good fit for you.

Has worked remotely. You have strong self-structure and discipline and have worked remotely either currently or in the past so you know the benefits and the challenges.

Wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization. PN is a pretty incredible place and is committed to allowing you to do the work you love and love the work you do.

Life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching. That's our mission at Precision Nutrition.

As an organization, we:

  • Seek and support diversity.
  • Offer 4 weeks paid time-off, benefits, and the ability to work remotely.
  • Set you up with whatever fancy gear you need to perform at your best.
  • Give you the flexibility to make your own schedule.

Not only that, but if you join us you can:

Work in the fitness and nutrition industry. We love exercise, we love nutrition, and we love sport. That’s why we started this company. If you do too, you’ll appreciate how rare it is to find a career you really love. For active, fit people, Precision Nutrition is that opportunity.

Work with fun, bright, and talented people. We’re a small company, and we’re picky about who we work with, because to us, this isn’t just a job; it’s our life.

If you or someone you know is interested please apply below.
subjects: Other, Data & Analytics, Production, Sales, Nutrition, Operations, Fitness, Industry

name: Software Engineer_30411
description:
About Us

TradeTapp is an early stage startup whose focus is on using technology and financial analysis to help the construction management industry make better decisions. Our product is a SaaS platform that assists general contractors in collecting, analyzing, and vetting the companies they hire to do the actual building.  We were founded in early 2016 by a construction industry expert along with two software developers.  Since launching, TradeTapp has already been adopted by some of the leading construction firms in the country, and is showing opportunity for significant future growth.

As we expand our development team, we are looking for software engineers interested in getting in at the ground floor, building upon our culture, and being part of this exciting phase of growth. This position will work closely with the founding team to advance our platform, lead in development of new features, and further shape the product for long term success.

Responsibilities

Being such an early startup, we can give you the opportunity to concentrate on the front-end, back-end, or a bit of both.  

  • Front End:  Building and updating features in Angular.  We are currently an AngularJS/Angular hybrid app looking to convert fully to Angular.  You would be working very closely with our design team to continuously push out features.

  • End Backend: The core of our backend is a Django/Python REST API built on PostgreSQL.  Here you’d be adding to and optimizing our endpoints, managing our data model, and updating our financial model and risk engine.

Beyond the technical responsibility, we are looking for someone who has a founders mentality, because that's exactly what first employees are.  Whether that’s developing best practices or finding better ways to communicate between our various teams, we need people who will help us be the best at turning an idea into something we can deliver to our clients.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • Willing to take ownership and challenge how things are done in a team environment

  • Good understanding and interest of UI and UX design - passsionate about the details!

  • Be extremely self-motivated

  • Desire to be in a startup/early stage company where the pace is fast and you can be an integral part of our growth

Location & Benefits

  • We intend to open a New York City office in the very near future so an NYC based Engineer is preferred, however, this position can be filled remote.

  • Willingness to work from home or shared communal space on a interim basis

  • Unlimited vacation (you should have a life, just get your work done)

  • Flexible hours

Core Technologies:

  • Javascript/AngularJS/Angular(5)

  • Python/Django

  • SQL/PostgreSQL

  • HTML

  • REST API

  • Heroku

  • SASS
subjects: Computer Science, Data & Analytics, Microsoft, Management, Industry, Apple

name: Solutions Architect_30421
description:
meltmedia is seeking a Solutions Architect to help us continue to deliver exceptional, web-based, technical solutions to our clients' problems. In addition to making our clients' lives easier through technology, you will also be highly involved in continuously improving the technical strategy of our various lines of business and help shape the overall technical strategy for the organization.

Your day in the life will be varied. You will work with our business development team to outline viable solutions for potential clients. You will work with established cross-discipline teams as they take your visions and make them their own, while ensuring the deliverables ultimately solve the clients' problems. You will also be expected to share your knowledge with your teammates, mentoring others through the challenges you have previously faced.

The right candidate will have extensive experience in the trenches, developing custom software solutions for clients. You will be an expert translator, from the clients' high level visions, into low-level technical details, and back. You are the type of person who has a strong desire to sit face-to-face with the client to understand their pain, while also needing to write some code from time-to-time. You understand there are often simple technical solutions to what may seem like unsurmountable problems to our clients. You thrive on making people's lives easier.

We are a cloud-first shop. You will have extensive knowledge in the full AWS stack. Ideally you’ve even jumped through the hoops of being officially certified as an AWS Solutions Architect. Our solutions vary based on the needs of our clients. We tend to develop custom solutions around our clients existing investments in products such as Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal 8, Veeva, Salesforce, and Pardot.  Any experience with these platforms would be highly beneficial.

Our custom solutions are a polyglot approach that may use Java, client and server-side JavaScript, Python, and PHP, depending on the needs of each project. We don’t believe in having a client spend more money than necessary, therefore we prefer “serverless” solutions when appropriate.

As a Solutions Architect, there will be ample opportunity to introduce new and better technology, techniques, and solutions that grow our expertise and ultimately provide better solutions for our clients.

Your prior experiences and the impact you personally had on the outcomes of those solutions, good and bad, will ultimately be the most important factor in determining if you are the right person for this role.

Along with a resume listing your relevant experience, please submit a cover letter explaining why you are the perfect fit for what we seek.
subjects: Other, Media, Sales, Strategy, Salesforce

name: Sr. Designer_30349
description:
Position Summary: 

We’re looking for a mid-to-senior visual designer who is equal parts problem-solver and visual storyteller. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in graphic design, and has experience working in brand identity, UI and print media. You’re able to think strategically about marketing challenges and approach design with a meticulous—borderline obsessive—sense of craft.  You can tell a good story (visually and verbally) to sell an idea. You’re conceptual and strategic in your approach. You’re ambitious, and willing to go the extra mile to make the work stand out. Above all, you’re a team player, collaborative and easy to work with. Oh yes! And you must like office dogs. 

The Must-haves: 

  • Must be equally fluent in print and digital design and production methods. 
  • Must be comfortable being client-facing, with excellent written, verbal and visual presentation skills.
  • Must feel completely at home in Sketch, Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop and AfterEffects.
  • Must be able to think holistically about design systems and develop creative solutions within established brand and identity guidelines.

The Nice-to-haves: 

  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JS.
  • Additional skills like Illustration and/or motion design are a bonus. 
  • Solid understanding of UX and prototype tools like Axure, Principle, Figma, etc. 

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 3-5 years of hands-on design experience (preferably in an agency setting).
  • Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, communication design, new media or equivalent degree.
  • An impeccable eye for design, and an undying hunger to continually learn and improve.
  • Must have acute attention to detail, the ability to take a project from concept to completion, and be able to work on multiple simultaneous projects and timelines.

name: Sr. Software Engineer Full Stack_30344
description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in the continental U.S. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.

Why We Started Very

Not to oversimplify things, but our mission is to become the best IoT, blockchain, and machine learning product development shop in the world. We do this by hiring the best and investing heavily in them, both personally and professionally.

We Fully Embrace Working Remotely

About 30% of our team works out of our HQ in Chattanooga, TN, and the other 70% work remotely from various locations across the United States. We consider ourselves best-practitioners of the remote-first movement and believe a great team shouldn’t be restricted by geography.

What You’ll Be Working On

Very is first and foremost a software consultancy, we tackle hard problems for clients who need a targeted, senior team to come in and provide specific solutions. We are focusing heavily on building out products that have applications in one of the three following areas: 1) data science & machine learning, 2) Internet of Things, and 3) blockchain. We’ve found that in each of these areas, the use of the underlying technology will drive the development of the core services , but that 75% of the work often still lives in the realm of modern web development.

At Very, there is a never ending supply of variety to the types of projects we work on. In the last year we’ve built solutions that touch e-commerce, trust management (finance), beer distribution, point of sale systems, ICO’s, identifying fake news, and much more.

You’ll spend 80% of your week (Monday through Thursday) designing and building a product or platform for one of our clients. The other 20% of your week (Friday) will be spent contributing to our open source projects, internal products, learning, teaching, and participating in internal operations of all flavors.

Project teams are small and usually made up of one or two pairs of engineers, a UX engineer, a product manager, and the client who serves as the product owner. We spend most of our time building new products, with the goal of helping our clients take it to market. We are often further engaged by our clients to continue iterating on the product once it is live. The high cost of context switching is real, so we do our best to keep teams together throughout the duration of their projects (typically 3-6 months), but have found it valuable to rotate pairing partners when it makes reasonable sense.

We are always exploring new tools, languages, and technologies. We feel strongly that it’s a good idea to use the best tool for the job and not see everything as a nail. We also try our best to standardize our technology and tooling across project teams so it’s easier to rotate and practice collective code ownership. We are currently building products and platforms using the following tools / platforms:

  • React & React Native

  • Swift & Objective C

  • Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves

  • Arduino (embedded C/C++)

  • Ethereum / Solidity

  • Ruby on Rails

  • Python

  • Pandas

  • Serverless

  • AWS (and a dash of Heroku where it makes sense)

Given that we work on quite a bit of greenfield projects, there is often room to experiment with new patterns and tools (within reason). We don’t expect applicants to know our entire toolchain, but rather to be capable, flexible, and self-directed.

This Role: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer

As a full-stack engineer at Very, you will work on a wide variety of projects and stacks. This job is a great fit for pragmatic polyglot programmers with a functional bend. Over the last few years, we’ve shipped countless Ruby on Rails projects and are at the tail end of moving to Elixir for the bulk of our services. Additionally, we have a strong Python contingent who are utilizing the serverless framework for the development of highly targeted microservices / systems as well as for data science and machine learning projects.

We value well-tested, reusable code and expect our engineers to be as good of practitioners as they are leaders and teachers.

How We Operate

We are believers in transparency and openness. In terms of organizational structure and governance, we are a holacracy. It’s worked pretty well for the us the last few years. When it comes to development processes, we do our best to adhere as closely to Extreme Programming as possible. We believe in hiring capable, responsible professionals. We don’t micromanage and trust everyone to work hard, experiment, learn from their mistakes, and contribute to each other and the company in a sustainable manner. We have no venture funding or external investors, which affords us the ability to be nimble and run our company in the best interest of our team as a whole.

How You’ll Be Compensated

We believe in a transparent, fair compensation structure and have developed our own open salary formula. Depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $80,000 and $135,000 upon joining the company. We have many health plans available through UHC—prices and plans vary based on your region—as well as vision and dental. We currently contribute a large portion to each plan, again, amounts vary based on region. As an added benefit, Very provides 1X Earnings Basic Life & AD&D. We have a 401k program that we’ll provide a 2% match on after a few months working with us. Lastly, 35% of the company’s ownership is reserved for a team member options pool.
subjects: Web Development, Other, Data & Analytics, Finance, Management, Operations, E-Commerce, Google

name: Sr. Software Engineer_30353
description:
Sr. Software Engineer // Phoenix & Nerves

Adult Beverage Company is a start up in the self-serve beer world. Our concept, called Hop, is currently open on the Las Vegas strip. We are in the process of further developing the product, making revolutionary changes to software and hardware with the intention of leading the way in this industry. We're looking for an experienced engineer that can be energetic about the concept, see its potential, and work to make our collective vision a reality. Setting and completing deadlines and communicating frequently with Upper Management will be required of this position. The ideal candidate will have experience in the development tools listed below, but will also be passionate about beer and excited about working for a new company with unlimited potential.

The current platform leverages the following modern frameworks and will be an exciting and stimulating codebase for the experienced full-stack developer:

  • Native iOS Client(s) - manages the tap-screens and the customer on-boarding process. This is the customer’s primary interaction with the Hop platform. Codebases are written in both Swift and Objective C

  • Hardware - Raspberry Pi controlling a custom hardware configuration. The software controlling these devices has been written using Elixir, leveraging the Nerves framework

  • Web Application (API) - A central API to manage the orchestration of all the devices and various consumers, this is also written in Elixir, largely utilizing the phoenix framework

  • AWS Lambda - image processing and AWS Rekognition, primarily python

This Role: Sr. Software Engineer // Full Stack

This role will develop and manage the api and hardware services listed above. The ideal candidate will be a senior engineer who is also experienced in developing elixir. The platform is still under active development and once hired the candidate will be onboarded for a period of 6-8 weeks before assuming full ownership of the platform.

The ideal candidate will

  • Have 8+ year experience developing web applications

  • Have 2+ years elixir development

  • Have worked in real time systems

  • Be passionate about writing tests, automation and continuous deployment

  • Embrace Agile / XP

  • Understand the excitement of remotely controlling hardware from a web application

This is a full time contract position with on-call responsibilities.

Competitive Salary, D.O.E

Benefits are currently not offered by Adult Beverage Company

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Remote

To apply, please send an email with the subject line “Hop - Full Stack Engineer” to jobs-hop@verypossible.com with the following information:

  • What’s most important to you from a company culture and operating environment?

  • What are the biggest things that de-motivate you and make you unhappy when it comes to being an engineer working on teams within a company?

  • Your resume
subjects: Development Tools, Management, Hardware, Industry

name: Sr. UX Designer_30352
description:
Want to improve the lives of a couple million people?

Were seeking a passionate contract UX designer to join our team that crafts tools used by millions of people around the world. Youll focus on the needs of a diverse set of people to help them prepare for the expected and handle the unexpected through the course of their day. You will be an important member of our design team, made up of individuals that actively support one another and love to solve problems.

Sound exciting? Great, read on!

What Youll Be Doing

Partnering with the Design Team Lead, product managers, developers and others throughout the company, youll think through every aspect of core features, crafting new solutions that put the humans who use HotSchedules at the forefront. Youll implement a new design direction that focuses on the people that keep your favorite restaurants humming. The space we work in is deep, so you will have the opportunity to learn and design for a wide array of customer needs and challenges. The designs that you craft will be relied upon in a variety of contexts, from small phones to desktops across a wide variety of physical environments such as loud kitchens, behind the bar or in a back office. Youll make the complex, simple.

What Were Looking For

  • A portfolio that showcases your UX chops (wireframes, user stories, flows) and product design skills. Were looking to see your product design work, not websites or marketing collateral. Please include a link with any needed passwords with your application.
  • 5+ years of experience as a professional designer working on web or mobile products or services.
  • A true passion for user-centered design and an understanding of how to unite user goals with those of our business.
  • You understand the value of mentorship and enjoy helping other designers improve their work.
  • Mastery of Sketch or similar design tools (we use Sketch) and experience with InVision or similar prototyping tools.
  • A deep understanding of web and mobile design constraints.
  • Experience implementing and improving a design system.
  • You are interested in user research and want the opportunity to conduct, document and share the findings from in-context observations and user interviews.
  • The ability to jump from high-level concepts into detailed design conversations, and back again.
  • You are collaborative and communicative by nature. You know how to deliver and receive constructive criticism.
  • You have opinions, but you leave your ego at the door.
  • Bonus points for restaurant experience. Youve worked in restaurants or bars (double bonus points if youve designed apps that focus on people who work in the service industry, such as scheduling systems or Point of Sales (POS) solutions.

About this contract

  • 5 months long
  • Must be onsite at our offices in NW Austin
  • FULL HEALTH, DENTAL and VISION insurance even for contractors!
  • Paid holidays
subjects: Other, Design Tools, Sales, Industry

name: Technical Lead_30407
description:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact candidates on our behalf. 

Think Company is looking for an experienced Technical Lead to join our Development Team! Think Company is a team of business-minded designers, developers, and thinkers who help our clients envision, design, and create great experiences for their customers and employees. We assist our clients in creating, designing and developing their ideas, executing on those ideas, and making them a reality.

The Technical Lead is part of the core team of any project and the primary technical point of contact throughout its life cycle, including kickoff, research, design, development, and delivery. S/he works with our clients to understand their current technical state, recommends solutions that empower our clients to succeed in their goals, and leads a team of developers to successfully deliver those technology solutions.

The ideal candidate for this role is a senior full-stack developer or technology consultant who is comfortable both with writing code and with socializing the problem or solution. Candidates for this role must have development experience, including writing code and/or coaching others to write code that meets industry standards and best practices. Candidates should also be able to demonstrate prior experience with setting and ensuring compliance with coding standards, making browser and device support recommendations, solving application architecture challenges, advising on content management workflow and CMS configuration, analyzing and remediating page performance issues, and addressing accessibility issues. Candidates should have experience in accurately scoping projects, defining project requirements, translating business requirements into technical requirements, architecting the technical environment and hosting infrastructure, identifying milestones and managing a delivery team against those milestones.

Technical Lead Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of client’s business and technology stack; establish and maintain a positive relationship with the client; represent Think Company with professionalism and integrity
  • Work collaboratively as part of a team that includes visual/UX designers, developers, project managers, and other roles (both clients and internal colleagues), flexing between a leadership or supporting role as required
  • Architect technical solutions that meet clients' business, IT, and user needs, and that balance time, budget, and quality considerations appropriately
  • Manage developers to deliver technical solutions on-time and on-budget, based on a technical delivery plan; work with project manager to communicate technical team status and manage client expectations
  • Research and document web development technologies, trends, and innovations, and make recommendations or deliver presentations to clients and internal colleagues

Skills and Requirements:

  • Extensive experience determining and analyzing technical project requirements, creating and managing a plan of work including identifying deliverables and estimating time
  • Significant experience in leading and coaching a development team to deliver technical deliverables on-time, on-budget, and on-spec
  • Deep understanding of the modern web platform and common architectural solutions
  • Significant experience with front-end development practices including accessibility, progressive enhancement, cross-browser/platform compatibility, performance; and pre-processors/build tools
  • Significant experience with web application development on both the front-end (Angular, React, etc.) and back-end (PHP, .NET, Python, Ruby on Rails, etc.), and an understanding of the tools and platforms needed to host these solutions
  • Significant experience with content management systems (AEM, Sitecore, Drupal, WordPress, etc.) including data and information architecture, templating, workflow, etc.
  • Experience with git, svn, or similar version control systems and knowledge of Git Flow methodologies
  • Deep familiarity with user experience (UX) design processes (conceptual design, wireframes, usability testing)
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Exceptional customer service skills and obsessive attention to detail

Think Company's developers are passionate about crafting code that is as beautiful and as elegant as our designs. We believe in web standards, progressive enhancement, and accessibility. We aim to build an open and faster web while delivering real value for our clients. We are a team of individuals with diverse skills who love learning and sharing knowledge. We hope you will join us!

To apply, please submit a cover letter or statement of interest, a resume, and three URLs featuring your code (or a link to your Github account with at least three projects). We look forward to hearing from you!

About Think Company

Think Company is an experience design consultancy that provides research, user experience design, and software development services to Fortune 500 clients in a wide range of industries. Think Company has been named one of the Best Places to Work by the Philadelphia Business Journal for three years in a row.

Think Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Perks

  • Competitive salary and excellent benefits, including health, dental, life, and disability insurance; 401 (k); paid time off; and individual training budgets
  • Regular company outings and hosts to local meetups like CTO School and UX Book Club, plus two PTO days to volunteer for the cause of your choice
  • Awesome teammates who are committed to growing skills and sharing knowledge
  • Inspiring, creative workspaces in Conshohocken, PA and Center City Philadelphia: both with easy access to public transportation and within walking distance of great restaurants

name: UX Designer (HTML/CSS)_30402
description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com, the market leading online accommodationreservation service in the world) is looking for the worlds smartest designers. Join the worlds leading accommodation company and help define the future of travel. This position offers the successful candidate the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements, impacting millions of people. Youll join us at our beautiful Amsterdam HQ and work with some of our industrys smartest people.

B.responsible

As a UX Designer youll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like group which takes full ownership of their part of our platform. Designer is just what it says on your CV youd be just as happy to be labeled an Engineer, or Analyst; a Builder, Maker or Problem Solver. Your portfolio is a collection of stories that you can discuss with enthusiasm, and regret because youre always getting better at what you do and youre never satisfied with good enough. Youre excited about the endless potential of the web and being able to build things that millions of people can use every day.

B.skilled

As a candidate for the UX Designer position, you possess a broad range of abilities:

  • You are comfortable with each part of the design process, from research to exceptional UI design, through to shipping production code
  • You are proficient with HTML & CSS
  • You have experience with template engines to display data from the backend youd be implementing your work using our in-house templating engine (dont worry well show you the ropes!)
  • You are comfortable creating the wireframes, polished mockups, and prototypes needed to communicate them (e.g., Sketch, Framer, InVision)
  • Your strengths include being self-driven and taking full ownership of your ideas to solve challenging problems
  • You are comfortable working collaboratively with developers, product owners, and copywriters
  • You thrive on feedback and critique, responding with creative thinking and iterative design
  • You are a passionate advocate for the user, dedicated to the craft of design and creating elegant user experiences
  • You understand and thrive in an environment which employs extensive A/B testing Booking.com is a data-informed company

B. Experienced

Were looking for Designers with a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, ideally with some history of working in e-commerce & data-informed organisations.

Designers at Booking.com must be excellent collaborators we work in an agile, dynamic, diverse environment in which openness & humility are key. Our designers combine their knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to deliver a world-class user experience to our diverse, loyal user-base. At Booking.com, design is a team sport, and together we solve hard problems while keeping the user at the center of everything we do.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is part of our core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and know that a team of different backgrounds, abilities, and perspectives makes us thrive and build better products. We are fortunate to be members of one of the most diverse design teams in the world and we do our best work when we join forces. Were looking forward to welcoming you into our team of exceptionally talented and fun colleagues, where youll do challenging and rewarding work.

You will also contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts

B.offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the Booking Deal with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has regular hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a UX Designer (HTML/CSS) in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

name: UX Engineer - CONTRACT OR FT_30339
description:
At Maark we believe that every interaction a user has with a product should be designed with them in mind. That doesn't just take the combined efforts of user experience and visual designers but also the designers who build the interactions. UX Engineers bring designs to life and sweat every detail. They focus on adding animations and details to interfaces not to just delight users but to improve their understanding of what the UI is doing. At Maark we believe this role is extremely important to creating the best possible experience for our clients and their customers.

As a UX Engineer at Maark you will work as part of the design team and develop front-end interfaces for the web. This is primarily a development role and will work closely with the engineering team as well. As part of the design process you will translate concepts into prototypes to test potential animations, interactions, design details, and feedback mechanisms. As a team we all try to keep up on the design industry and we'd look to you to contribute input on trends and new ways for users to interact with devices and interfaces.

As a team, we work together in person at least once a week but for the rest of the week we work remotely. Over the years we have found that people who are well organized and are comfortable managing their own personal time fit best. On top of that, the clients we work with range from large financial institutions to telecoms to hospitality to bio-engineering — we love learning new subjects and researching our clients' businesses and look to work with people who are just as naturally curious.

What you would work on...

  • Building front-end interfaces for the web
  • Translating concepts into working prototypes
  • Iterating on interactions, animations, feedback, and design details reaching for the best experience possible
  • Providing input on trends and new ways for users to interact with devices and data

You may be a fit for this role if you...

  • Have a BA/BS degree in Computer Science, HCI, Design, or equivalent
  • Have experience developing for web applications
  • Have experience creating interactive prototypes
  • Have an expert understanding of HTML, CSS (SASS/Less), and JavaScript—specifically ES6, React, and Webpack
  • Care for code quality, user experience, and design details
  • Have a strong appreciation for design, typography, and visual systems
  • Are very well organized and strong personal time management
  • Have a natural interest in researching and learning new subjects and our clients' businesses

Nice to have experience

  • A design portfolio showcasing a strong foundation in typography, visual systems, interaction design, visual design, and a design process
  • Experience developing interfaces for iOS and/or Android
  • Experience in design planning and information architecture development

Full-Time Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • 100% health and dental
  • New 5k iMac or laptop
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Generous paid time off plan

About Maark

Maark is a strategic marketing and innovation agency for global companies - headquartered in Cambridge, MA. We help our clients define and articulate their vision, design new connected customer experiences, and develop applications at the intersection of where what’s possible meets what’s relevant. The Maark creative team is made up of artists, illustrators, designers, and developers, all focused on creating the best experiences for B2B markets.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better experience for our clients.

Maark is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of Maark to prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran-status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.
